did I offend you??

Kill me pills So here I am at work bored out of my skull and all I have to do is sit here and get paid. Most people would probably love that, but I on the other hand, hate it with all my life...................
confused I have no idea how to set up a comments section..........who would have thought that this would have been hard....why didn't anyone warn me.........
I was wrong.... I thought that when I would start this blog I would have a mouthful to say.....I have nothing but a broken heart......
ok first posting, my friend has made me her offical private investagator........YEAH for me!!!!!!!!!!
Well here I am with my first entry. I have nothing to say right now.

V-Day Sucks Although I am part of the majority that has a boyfriend, I still hate Valentines Day, and I have ever since I was 16. I used to think that it was because I was single, but then when I had boyfriends on that day I still hated it. Then I thought that maybe it was because I wasn't "really" in love with them.........................but now I do LOVE him (my current one) and I still woke-up hating today................oh well............where's the tuna..................oh nevermind........carry on.............

well 25........... well this weekend I turned the big 2 5, and I feel that I have been brought to a crossroad and I have to make a decision, should I stay or should I go???? I need to move on to bigger and better thingsm and I need to do it soon, cause 30 is only a few weeks away seeing as the years will just keep coming......
it's my party and I will cry if I want to, cry if I want to.......... you would cry too if you were turning 25!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! tear

OH MY GOD...... well now that the day has officially started (I just had a coffee) I can rehash all the mishaps from last night and laugh.....What can I say, we are funny funny girls!!!!!!!!!! Do to the high volume of birnocular (not sure how to spell it, but I know how to use them) use I find that I have become used to seeing things up close and personal and now I find that seeing things in regular vision is just not the same........So who are Mary and Teresa you ask, well they are just about as real as Nancy, Todd and Scott.....again what can I say Private Investigating is in our blood........and remember blood is thicker than water........
PICK UP THE PHONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
that awful feeling in your kidneys whenever I think of my ex-boyfriend I want to barf........what does that mean???
Age.... people who say age is just a number must only be 8 yrs old............it's not just number, it's the start of you 1/4 life crisis........in 2 days I am 25........kill me.......
Off Limits..... everything that i ever wanted is off limits....... how's that mayo run comming along........

NEVER..... I am never going to make it to Cali............why is that same state so expensive? why does the cnd $ suck? why doesn't everyone eat mayo? i am never going to make it there............never...........

SARS the whole god damn GTA is contaminated with this nasty deadly virus that is going around......I want to move out of this place and hide somewhere germ free........... who knows I have probably been contaminated myself and have no idea until of course it is too and late and only have 3 hours to live......... i hate this place today.......

Did you ever wonder.... why things just are?? why things are just there...............like candy, what the hell over made someone think of making candy?? Like seriously I have been addicted to Sweetarts for the past 3 weeks, those and Tim Horton's coffee.........mmmm coffee...........I think I had to much today casue I am so jumpy.........jumpy...is that even word?? My day is almost done and thank god for that one!!! Yesterday I went to buy a card and I saw a woman with a mullet, I thought those were only avaliable for women in the US (no offense to my US readers, still love ya!) but seriously I have seen a lot more mullets over there than I have here............but that could only be becasue I have only really been to more US cities than any over here....hhhhmmmm maybe I should venture out to Winnipeg, I bet they have a whole highschool dedicated to those for the Hair Inpaired........I should look into..............till then I will only assume that mullets are hardcore American things.......USA!!! USA!!!! one of the funest (is that even a word) countires to visit...........NEW YORK CITY ROCKS.........so does VEGAS!!! Carry on....

Comments I still can't get this thing to work...most likely casue I am dumb when it comes to computers.....but this nice girl jenny tried helping me but I still can't............hopefully someone will........email me if you know how at pulling_missions@hotmail.com please and thank you all so very much......

when will it end.... I am seriously getting tired of hearing about the war all day and all night....and it's not that I don't care, it's just that it gets depressing.....too depressing.....till this day I still get watery eyes as soon as someone mentions 9/11...it was too sad and all these casualties are just as sad.....I hate knowing that someone will have to grow up with no dad........I know how much that can affect someone since my mom lost her dad in the war when she was only 11 months.......so I hope it all ends a lot sooner then they expect...... on a lighter note.....I am getting old and I am having a hard time adjusting to this new phase of my life.....you know the one where you and all your friends stop hanging out as much as you have in the past and things start to change and you start having to save money for the "future"......ya I hate it............why me.........why any of us........why won't this phone stop ringing today? why? why? why?.......

well..... ok so I am here and I am back at work and I wanna go home, feel very sick today....very light headed and I have no idea.......can't even manage to keep my eyes open really.............will write more later.........

TGIF so thank god it's friday!!! i was getting tired of waking up early. now I can sleep in and wake up to another gloomy day...I wish that the sun would shine all day......I think I would be a lot happier, not that I am not happy, but I think I would just be double happy...if that is even a phrase.......so this weekend I will probably spend another bunch of money on things I don't need.....but seriously who doesn't need $200 Seven jeans....come on they fit soooooo good......and who doesn't need anything ROXY......that stuff rules..... maybe I will head out to the movies with some friends, maybe watch A View From the Top....." I want my booties and I want my warm nuts" ...... Mike Myers is just LOL funny......good times.....maybe we will go out and find some hotties to look at, maybe just maybe.......or maybe I will try to figure out how to set up Blog Feedback so you can leave some comments......maybe I will.....maybe I will......
i am happy... i made a complete stranger named jenny happy today......my work here is done....

Long time no talk.... ok so I haven't been here in a long time, but seriously I think it deosn't make a difference cause I really don't think that anyone even reads this, well maybe they do but since I can't get my comments to work for me I can't get any......so waht has been new, nothing really...it's getting warmer, I still hate my job, and I am just basically waiting for summer to come, that's all really......I wish I had an exciting life to talk about....I wish my life was like some of the ones I see in the movies.......they have so much fun and they seem like things just fall into place for them.........why is everything so easy for them.........wait before you freak, I know that it's all in the script.........but I wish that someone would hand me a script for this life.......maybe this way I wouldn't make so many mistakes on my lines if I had some time to practice them before we shoot the scene.........
Hmmm "I love you like a fat kid loves cake" 50 Cent LOL..........LOL...........LOL...........

Password: Go To Hell So I woke up this morning with a weird feeling. You know that feeling you have when you have a weird dream, you can't remember it, but you can't figure out what's real and what's not real. Well that is how I felt this morning. I couldn't remember what I did last night and I couldn't remember if I was mad, but I felt that way. Later on my way to work I realized that I was mad, and it was totally out of my hands. My friend who shall remain nameless has a bad habit of getting really moody at least one week out of the month and taking it out on me. She calls and says nothing, just sits there breathing, why did you call me? if you have nothing to say, just sit there at your house and don't call me. Then when I try to make small talk she will bite my head off for asking something that she thinks is totally ridiculous. To that again I say "call me when you realize that I have done nothing wrong....." She is miserable and thinks that she is the only one with problems, you know those problems when you are a size 4 and think you are fat....ya those kind....so now I sit here and think "shit my head hurts" , and really where did I go wrong, where was it that I was to go left and not right? I wish I had a rewind button for my life.....don't you?

People are strange So it's Tuesday and I am back at work after a weekend from hell.......so let's see it all started off Friday night, when we decided to go to the movies, I wanted to watch "Bend it Like Beckham" (I think that is how you spell the last name) and instead they decided to watch "Phone Booth", which wasn't bad at all, but I am just not a fan of Colin Farrell, I think mainly because 95% of the female population is. So saturday I hung out a friends place and got a sun burn on my face which was not in any way my intentions, and it is still red till today....I have no idea when it will turn a nice shade of brown to give my olive complection alittle more colour, as if I need it. So later that night we headed to a club that we normally go to and have no problems there, however saturday night was a different story. First off there were A LOT of weird peole there that night, mainly the 4 foot 11, 12 year old looking who tried all night to pick-up my friend ans his oh so obviously gay friend trying to hit on me. So we went to another room and it just got worse....so we hung out for a bit then decided to leave and head out for some food to soak up all the alcohol we had consumed. So I rolled in at around 3:45am and watched tv, and realized I was getting old. I know, I know, I am only 25, but I am getting tired of seeing weirdos in clubs and bars. What ever happen to having house parties where I could look forward to hearing the Beasite Boys till 4 am and thinking that we did have to fight for our right to party and where can I find this "Brass Monkey". All those days seem to be long behind me. Sunday came and I had to do some stuff around town and I was starting to feel ill....Monday came and I was to be in court at 9 am all the way in cottage counrty, so needless to say I didn't get a lot of sleep sunday night, and last night was just as bad...I think I feel asleep at 11:30pm woke up at 12:30 am and only feel back asleep at 3:30am, then I had to wake up at 6:30 and that was a struggle. And just to add to my sleepless night, I had watched "The Ring" early yesterday afternoon and it creeped me out to the point where I thought the little girl was going to crawl out of my tv and kill me. Yup! I am a chicken when it comes to scary movies......I think it all started when my babysitter made me watch the Exorcist at age 5...ya I think that's as far back we can trace this fear...... So here I am back at work wondering why I am back here and why I haven't moved on....I am so tired of talking that I think I am actually going to start doing things..........we'll see how that goes, I will keep you posted.....
ok ok ok I need a new job, asap.........

Friday I'm in love...... I am so happy that it is finally Friday, and the weekend is just about 6 hours away from starting. I have to say that I friday is my favorite day of the week. So did anyone watch last nights episode of Will and Grace?? I thought that it was hilarious even though Madonna was on it. Don't get me wrong, I think she is a great singer, but I believe that this episode of Will and Grace once again proved that she should stick to singing, and singing only..... And now the Friday Five , once again I am going to participate, cause I like this one, here goes.... 1. What was the last TV show you watched? Will and Grace 2. What was the last thing you complained about and what was the problem? I was having difficulty breathing, I have asthma and the weather here kills me. 3. Who was the last person you complimented and what did you say? My boyfriend, and I told him that he was the #1 reason I get up each morning. 4. What was the last thing you threw away? A napkin with oreo cookie crumbs in it. 5. What was the last website (besides this one) that you visited? The WB website.

who else can I bother..... it's sunny here today and I love it, I am in a better mood today and I have found that the sun makes me smile. A few quick questions; Is it just me or are you all sick of seeing Jen and Ben in every magazine? And is it just me or have you all realized that Kelly Osbourne only has a record deal becasue of her last name? I wonder if she knows......if you see her over there in LA, tell her what I think about her! thanks............oooooooooohhhhhhhhhh I love this song...."No Letting Go" by Wayne Wonder......does anyone know it, it's a new song..........I love it I love it.....

90210 Ok, my friend just emailed me to tell me that Beverly Hills 90210 is coming back with a reunion show....OH MY GOD.....I used to watch that show religiously....Brenda was my favorite......ok I know you all think that I am some wanna be valley girl, but I'm not....I do however wish that I lived in LA....I would be a surfer I think......and after reading everyones "Friday Five" I saw that all the people who lived in LA have seen so many stars.....I am now officailly jealous of all of you..... So other than that I don't think anything else exciting has happend...hmmmm....well last night I went by my friends house to try on clothes cause she has her own clothing line so I got to order Fall/Winter 2003 merchandise before it hits the store, and I got to get a sneak peek at what to expect for Spring/Summer 2004.....nice stuff.....other than that life here in TO is pretty boring......
today.... today I added something new to this page............today I still hate my job and the world......carry on.......

First time for everything... I have never done the Friday Five casue I have never liked them and then I forgot to check last Friday so today I am doing them and I know I am late....I'm only doing them cause I like this one....... 1. Who is your favorite celebrity? Reese Witherspoon 2. Who is your least favorite? Hmm I have many.....Winona Ryder and Milla Jocovich 3. Have you ever met or seen any celebrities in real life? Hmmm I think I saw Ross from friends once, but I doubt it was him.....oh ya I saw the singer from Our Lady Peace once buying muffins... 4. Would you want to be famous? Why or why not? God yes that has been my dream for years......I guess cause I think they have a better life and I would just love to be part of a tv show...they look like they have so much fun..... 5. If you had to trade places with a celebrity for a day, who would you choose and why? I think that I would have to choose Jennifer Lopez...only cause she has a lot of money and I would really like to see if she has to work as hard as she says she has to to earn it.
EVERYTHING Today is not a good day....I have to pay a lot of people that I don't know a lot of money...........I hate the world today......I hate my life today.....I wonder what's for dinner.........

HBO So I haven't written anything in a while and yesterday I just put in lyrics to a song that best described my mood yesterday.......today I still feel that way.... I have watched almost all the episodes of season 1 and 2 of Six Feet Under, and yet it did not prepare me for what I had to go through this weekend...I sat at a funeral all Sunday and all Monday, and now the house that I go home to is missing one person and it feels really weird. I realized this weekend that dying is a really strange thing, and not only till it hits home do you realize that people really do have to eventually leave and there is nothing that you can do about it to make yourself feel better, except just let time pass and go on with your life. It's strange, I wondered all weekend long if she could see us there crying and then my sister told me that she had a dream of my grandmother and she told my sister that she was ok now and that she was no longer suffering..... I don't want to die, it's too sad for all the people left behind to miss me......life is really strange......I have to start changing things in my life, and I have to start now......

Why Does It Always Rain On Me..... I can't sleep tonight Everybody saying everything's alright Still I can't close my eyes I'm seeing a tunnel at the end of all these lights Sunny days Where have you gone? I get the strangest feeling you belong Why does it always rain on me? Is it because I lied when I was seventeen? Why does it always rain on me? Even when the sun is shining I can't avoid the lightning travis
Did you ever..... I keep burping barf......it's SO gross............

Lights go out and I can't be saved...... So it's Thursday morning and I feel ok, except for the fact that I have to be here at work. I hate my job....I do payroll.........I want to leave but I feel like I can't, like I am stuck....I know too much about payroll that I am actually really good at it......but it is no longer challenging........I hate that.....does anyone else feel the same way as me? I woke up this morning and my eye was twitching, I hate that, I could barley drive into work this morning, I kept winking with my left eye....I think that guy in the car next to me thought I was trying to come on to him.....maybe that's why he was always making sure that he was going the same speed as me....... So the weekend is almost here and last night when me and my friends went out for drinks we decided to go to a club this weekend. Now normally I am the last person to hesitate to go out to a club, but because of this SARS thing, I fear going out in places where I will encounter a large number of people.......maybe I should wear a mask, but I think that would only freak people out......oh well......looks like I am staying home....ya right....that will never happen...........

what's with today, today? today i feel like i should have stayed in bed.....even though it is a nice sunny day today, i wish i was back in my bed under my covers...........i have nothing good to say, only bad, but i won't share and bring everyone down.......what's with today??

What a weekend from hell...... Well I guess I will start off by explaining why exactly my weekend was from hell.......let's see......it all started Thrusday night when my usual 25 minute drive home from worked turned out to be 1 hour and half due to an ice storm we were having, and might I add that only in Canada can you go from sunny 15 degrees to have a cold front bring in a ice storm. So my night progressed into lounging infront of the tv watching Friends, Will & Grace and Good Morning Miami. I then feel asleep on the couch woke up at 2 am to go to my room.Finally it was morning and I was woken up by the radio announcer telling us that all of TO was covered in a thick layer of about 10 cm of ice......so needless to say I went back to bed......I woke up later to trek out in the ice covered streets for a long overdue hair cut that I could not bare to cancel the appointment. Later that day it rained more ice pellets causing me to stay home again that night and watch some movies on Direct TV......saturday began with some more ice freezing the city and then I had a lame ass wedding to attend, went home thinking I was going to go out but I closed my eyes for what I thought was 5 minutes, only to find myself waking up Sunday morning at 10am but it was really 11am cause we had to change the time by putting it an hour ahead, thus throwing me off the whole day.........finally it was ok to head out without the fear of dying only to come home and have to shovel all that ice off of my drive way because for the past few days I had been sliding into the driveway and almost hitting my garage......so then I figure I treat myself to some dining out only to come home with the worse case of gut wrought in a very long time (gut wrought is also known as severe pains in your stomach).......finally I woke up this morning, late and in severe pain from shovelling all day yesterday, and I am here at work only to find out that someone I was with last week now has the chicken pox.....can you kill me cause I have only had a mild case as a child and now I fear catching them again....... one last thing I think i forgot to mention is that Friday night I had a fever and I thought that I had contaracted SARS which can kill you so I was scared and I called the hot line and the lady told me I was fine aslong as I wasn't in China or in an airport or near someone who was infected. Now people have called me crazy for paniking, but to be honest, it is on the news just as much as the coverage of the War in Iraq, just that since we are in Canada and not in the US, we have no fancy graphics or clever slogans to announce what is happening.......regardless still scary to be around people..... so that was my weekend, but now I hear that we are going to get another 10 - 15cm of snow tonight......grrrreeeeaaaat!!! when will it end??!?!?!?!? the good news here is that Friday it will be 15 degree again, hopefully melting all the snow and left over ice.....good times, good times......

Home, is where I wanted to go...... Ok so here I am at work for another fun filled day of internet surfing.....why? cause there really isn't anything else to do here on Thursdays.....there is actually nothing to do here on Fridays either, so I spend these 2 days just looking for funny things to send to my friend Brooklyn to make her laugh......so she is the one having guy trouble, you know the who never called, well I found out yesterday that she called him, even though I told her over and over not to call, she did, and he still never called her back......I think that NOW it is safe to say that he will not call back.......too bad...... Ok now for some fun stuff..... Things I am really into: ( I had a friend email me this list today) 1. Direct TV for Felicity reruns 2. Fabolous new song "Can't Let You Go" 3. Ketchup flavoured Doritos (well kinda, I am still confused when I eat them) 4. Compulsive disorders 5. My little ponies 6. Alcohol induced vomitting 7. Seven Jeans 8. White belts 9. Pointy boots/shoes 10. A new tattoo Things I am totally over: 1. The constant televised War footage 2. Being scared of dying 3. Scary movies 4. the movie The Ring 5. My dish card going down 6. Jen and Ben's love life 7. My phone always ringing 8. 50 Cent 9. Crank Calls 10. Not knowing what to have for lunch Oh ya, and I still love Dawson's Creek.....yes I know I am 25 and shouldn't be watching it, but I do, so get over it....and Will and Grace.....I love you Karen Walker.......my new goal is to be like her when I am 35, you know a pill popping, alcoholic with money and no heart.......YEAH NEW GOAL!!!!
OK I SWEAR IT WAS THERE 2 SECONDS AGO......I SWEAR IT WAS!!!! i will write more later.....

I DID IT!! Ok for the perverts who think I am talking about having sex, well you are wrong, that is not what I am talking about. If you look at the bottem of this entry you will see a section for comments, yes I finally have place for feedback.....I would like to send out a special shout out to Jenny Smith for helping me......YOU RULE!!!!! If we were in school I would vote you for Prom Queen!!!!!

WHY THEY NEVER CALL.... "I think I threw up a little bit..." ya so I don't get it when a guy tells you I will call you back later today, and then it is 3 weeks and you still haven't heard form him.....I don't get it.......luckily for me I have a boyfriend and I don't have this problem, but i find that it is becoming a problem for all the singletons I know...........I just don't get it.............why can't you just call and why if it's not working can you not call and just say it??? So if you are wondering why I said I threw up a little.....well it has been from all the dinking at clubs with all the my friends having this problem and trying to drink it away.....they can hold there liquor, I on the other hand can't..........especially when I am dancing all not long......kinda like Lionel Ritchie.......... so if you know why they never call, I would say comment but since I can't figure it out how to get it to work, so you can let me know at pulling_missions@hotmail.com

I made a mistake.... I have a bad habit of doing things when I am not fully ready, example the Friday Five. I always jump into it without thinking, so I would like to go back and change something, I know that I can edit my blog and change the actual first response I put, but I feel that it to describes me so I will leave it, but I will answer it again, for a second chance to tell you all what I am really about, and I believe that this next quote best describes me.... 2. What quotation best fits your outlook on life? " Fate exists but it can only take you so far, because once you're there it's up to you to make it happen ." ---Jenna Elfman in her roll in urlLink Can't Hardly Wait When I heard that line, for some reason, it seemed to really hit me and I realized that that is the best outlook on life. thank you for your time and letting me tell you the "real" quote for my life!

When things finally go good..... Today is Friday, YAY!! That means I can sleep in tomorrow. However, it sucks casue I have no plans, yet, except to go shopping to find an outfit for a wedding I have in a couple of weeks. It will of course be very boring and dull. Unlike other bloggers, I hate weddings, they cost too much and you have so many in one year that you have to take out a mortgage in them. Anyway now the Friday Five; 1. What do you most want to be remembered for? I think I want to be remembered most for being a fun, loving and caring person, who always went out of her way to help others. 2. What quotation best fits your outlook on life? Live for today and not for tomorrow 3. What single achievement are you most proud of in the past year? I haven't really achieved anything in the past year, I am still working on it. 4. What about the past ten years? The past 10 yrs, I guess I would have to say doing all the things I did, good or bad, and learning from them and choosing the right path. 5. If you were asked to give a child a single piece of advice to guide them through life, what would you say? I think I would tell them that no matter what anyone tells them, they can do and they can be whatever they want to be in life. Also that they should live everyday to the fullest and never lose sight of who they are and who they want to become.

"If you like Pina Colada's and getting caught in the rain...." So in 3 days it will be June, summer is almost here, well in Canada, it's seems like it will never come, but us Summer loving Canucks are keeping our, well my, fingers crossed. I love the summer and I can't wait to wear my flip flops without having to bring a pair of shoes in the car, for when the sunsets and we retreat back to fall gear. I think that if it doesn't happen soon I will cry. So this weekend's plans have been brought to a stand still. I thought I was going to have the whole house to myself, and now I have been notified of different plans. Oh well.....but don't you hate it when you think you can do something and you get all excited about it and then you findout that you can't, I hate that....... I have been thinking lately about how much I HATE Sundays. They are by far the most boring day of the week and I just hate waking up bored. I have a bridal shower to go to this weekend (yes, the 4th one this year!) on Sunday and I already not looking forward to waking up, but I have to go cause I already repiled that I was attending. But other than that I hate them. I seriously wake-up bored and depressed on Sundays. I have nothing to do or look forward to. If I go up to my cottage for the weekend, I wake-up and go to the beach, but they still depress me because I know that I have to go home and do laundry and get ready for work the next day. So no matter what I do here in TO, I can't shek the Sunday blues. So I realized that I need to move to a place that I wouldn't mind waking-up on Sundays in, you know somewhere fun and exciting with lots of things to do......I don't know, maybe I am just crazy......

Bangs, Bangs, and more Bangs My friends ex-boyfriend had hair that hung down over his forehead, thus he had bangs, he was also bipolar, well we think he was....someone saw him, he looked like a rocker they said, rocker, who still even uses that word??? Ya she said she wants bangs of her own, I said no cause her forehead is too small, but like a good friend that I am, I said I would cut them for her if she really wanted them...... So I am thinking of writing a book, well actaully I have been thinking about it for almost 2 years now, but I just can't seem to figure out what to write about. Should it be fictional? Should it be self-help? Should it be autobiographical? Do I even know how to spell that? All the questions plauge my mind and I have no idea where to start and where I should get a book to write in. Should I use a book to write in or should I go straight to my laptop?? Again more confusion. If anyone out there has any writing skills, please leave me a comment with your suggestions on where I should being. On a lighter note, I have to go see a doctor about my stomach....hopefully I am not dying, that would suck.....we'll see...till then I leave you this.... If you could fly away and never come back, would you do it? Why?

"No you owe ME 500 dollars!!" I think I want to change my career and become a window washer. I am sitting here at work today and there is a window washer outside the building washing our windows, and I am in here envious of him. He gets to dangle from a rope all day and get a nice tan on his back and neck and he also gets to peek into the windows and spy on the people on the other side of the window, kinda what he is doing now behind me. I wonder if he is envious of us and of our jobs? somone should tell him that sitting here at this desk isn't as glamorous as it looks.......I guess the same goes for his job. "As I sat out front in the early Sunday morning sun, I could feel the light breeze off the water and smell the buring wood in the air.....ahhh it's 28 degrees, it's May 25th and I smell the month of October....." My boyfriend told me that urlLink The Real World is starting again in June, this time they party in Paris, the city I was named after....coincidence? I think not.....maybe I should have auditioned for this one......too late now I guess........ So how was everyone's Memorial Day??

Ahhh the belated Friday Five...... 1. What brand of toothpaste do you use? Crest, I think... 2. What brand of toilet paper do you prefer? I don't buy any, my mom does and passes it out in the house. 3. What brand(s) of shoes do you wear? Diesel, Vans, Roxy, and shoes from Aldo, Stoneridge and Pegabo.....they have there own labels there.... 4. What brand of soda do you drink? Coca-Cola 5. What brand of gum do you chew? Excel, the dark blue pack, but today, Dentyne Ice, the green one. On a lighter note, I think I have a stomach hernia........kill me it hurts like hell and burns like fire..........

Leting Go So things seem to keep coming to an end. Last Friday we said to good-bye to urlLink Dawson and his friends, now last night I had no choice to say good-bye to urlLink Buffy and her friends and for those who watched it, we also had to say good-bye to Sunnydale. Letter From The Dead Dear Pete, I can't believe that it has been 5 years already since we last meet up in Vegas. I had no idea that would have been the last time we would have seen eachother. Your annoying attention to detail floors me, but yes I do remember that brown suit with the red flower on the pocket, but I do also remember the coffee stain on the your shirt, three buttons down. We had a laugh in that casino and I can't believe that people thought that we actually had a clue as to what we were doing in there, I truely believe that it had something to do with the suit! I miss those days and I wish we could be back there by the pool sipping on margaritas. In your last letter you said you were going to start getting in the habit of no drinking, no drugs, and no smoking, my question is when exaclty did you died and how come on one informed me of your funeral. You son of a bitch, I can't believe that you are putting all those days behind you. Who is she, and how come you let her do this too you? Obviously you know that deep down inside I am happy for you, but on the surface I feel like I am in mourning for the loss of a bestfriend. Call me when it all becomes offical and you decide to wear the the ball and chain. Don't forget to get your brown suit dry cleaned, and sit tight, I'll be back soon. Paris

Things best left unsaid.... As the fog slowly started to lift, we could finally see the road a head. Neither of us spoke as we watched ahead waiting in anticipation of what we would find. I remembered times when it seemed that this day would never come, and now finally we were here. We drove for about 10 miles before the fog completely lifted and I felt the butterfiles in my stomach flutter around a lot harder. I could feel the tears behind my eyes starting to sting. I knew this was it. He pulled up to the large gray building where we had met before. Outside was a gentleman in a black uniform collecting tickets. I wanted to leave without having to look at him, because I knew this time would he the hardest and it may have been the last. I picked up my bag and put my hand on the door handle as he started blankly at the night sky. He was biting his lip as though he needed to say something, but the lump in his throat reminded him he should not. I looked at him and smiled, he smiled back. We heard the man in the black uniform announce the time, and it made a tear roll down my left cheek. He leaned in and gave me a kiss on my cheek to wipe away the tear and whispered in my ear, "We will be together again, I promise." I felt a rush of heat flow through my body as my heart raced. "I never really knew why," I replied, "but I do now." I opened the door and stepped on to the wet pavement, it looked as the though the fog was starting to get thick again. I closed the door, looked at the time as I heard him drive off into the night. Today a lot of people are off because tomorrow is a holiday, I am here and I am sad. I saw my new nephew yesterday and it made me realize that I don't accept change very well. Something I will have to work on, or just something I will have to live with.

Time is on your side.... All week I have been wondering around aimlessly without a watch and with no concept of time. Now normally I wear my watch from the minute I leave the house till the second I go to bed because otherwise I would be lost without it, I would always be late and I would always wonder what time of the day it is. I used to make fun of my boyfriend and some of my friends who never wore watches, thinking that they were loser for never knowing what time it was and never knowing how many minutes till quitting time. But aftet this week I realize that I am the loser, I am the one suffering this whole time wearing a watching timing every minute of my day and every thing I do. I never realized how amazing the day could really be without a watch to constantly check the time, to make sure you were on time, to make sure you were doing things according to plan. I have had a less stressful week not wearing a watch. And now as I embark on the Canada Day long weekend, I will be watchless and I will have fun. To all those reading this, have an amazing weekend, Jenny don't forget to pack the OFF! Skintastic for the bugs.........see you on Monday!

Tell the dude in the black wet suit I say "hi"....... Well it's June 27th, it's almost July and school's out for summer. Almost everyone I know is going away this summer. One friend is working in urlLink Geneva for the summer, one other friend of mine is making his way across urlLink Europe , shopping, smoking, drinking and surfing his way around. Another moved across country to see if the grass is really greener on the otherside, another just picked up and left with no direction and no plan, and another is living in urlLink London for a month, to keep her best friend comapny while she takes a acting workshop. I have opted to stay here, in the same place I have been for 25 years, again for the 25th summer, I can only live vicariously through there photos, random emails and random postings as they journey to the other side and live life to the fullest. In one word, I am jealous. I would have loved to just pick up and take off for the summer to watch the sunset over the Pacific Ocean while I burry my feet in the sand. To stummble in the streets of urlLink New York drunk and loud, or shop in the crowded streets of urlLink Rome while the street vendors yell to get your attention, all the while being distracted from the smell of fresh bread baking in the bakery just across the street. Maybe even ponder life with my best friend in a urlLink Las Vegas casino at 4 am while the waitress brings us another rye and ginger to our slot machines, then head out to watch the sunrise by the hotel pool and then head to bed for a few hours. Take a drive up urlLink Mulholland Drive star gaze and watch the waves crash up against the coast. Look over to my friend and say "this is the reason why I live and breath", drive off to a small cafe, have some dinner and dance the night away in random bars and clubs till 6 in the morning. This is what I long for.....the good times they all speak about, I want to live them. Now the perfect urlLink Friday Five for my mood; 1. How are you planning to spend the summer [winter]? I plan on staying in the city hanging out with friends and reading about everyone else's amazing summer. 2. What was your first summer job? I don't think I have ever worked through the summer until I was done school and started working full-time. 3. If you could go anywhere this summer [winter], where would you go? I think I would venture out to urlLink LA , and all the other places mentioned above in my post. 4. What was your worst vacation ever? I think my worst one was urlLink Vancouver, BC , it was a very quiet and calm, I found it to be boring, but beautiful nonetheless. 5. What was your best vacation ever? I would have to say urlLink New York City , it was the first time I didn't want my vacation to end. I finally found out why everyone says "I Love New York", and I don't blame them.

That makes it 2 times Ok so this morning I come into work and I have an email from my managers telling me that they need to speak to me next friday at 11 am in regards to their expectaions of me, what does that mean? what do you want, what are they going to tell me? If your gonna fire me, thanks your actually doing me a favour, but that won't happen, I don't have the luck to get fired right in the peak of the summer and collect severance pay from them till the end of August. No. If I did get fired it would be right smack dab in the middle of what would be our coldest winter ever. Then I would be home during blizzards and snowstorms and all I would be able to do is shovel the driveway and sit by the window and wait for all the snow to melt off the grass and occasionally remove decorations from the Christmas tree, trying to hold on to the one good thing about winter. Then my mother will walk into the room with a look of sympathy on her face, she will smile, I will look at her and smile while I try to hold the tears in, she will walk over to me, I will sit there waiting patiently for her hug me, then she will look at me and say "get off my ass, take down the fuckin Christmas tree decorations and look for a job already cause it's February and you have been off since November." Then she will walk out of the room, my 3 yr old neice would walk in sit next to me and ask me if I would like a kiss to make me feel better. Why the vivid description, cause I know it all to well, it has happend before, but it was a mass comapny layoff, I wasn't fired that time. For now, just this.... The urlLink Friday Five : 1. What's one thing you've always wanted to do, but never have? I would say go to California, skydive and race car driving. 2. When someone asks your opinion about a new haircut/outfit/etc, are you always honest? Yes I think I am usually quite honest. 3. Have you ever found out something about a friend and then wished you hadn't? What happened? I think the most important thing a friend told me was that they were gay, but I was glad they told me. So no I have never had that happen to me. 4. If you could live in any fictional world (from a book/movie/game/etc.) which would it be and why? This is a hard one cause I already have a warpped sence of reality and I had a hard time in the past dealing with the fact that what happens on t.v. is planned, that's why real life sucks compaired to the movies. But if I have to choose, I think the show Felicity, only because she went to college away from home, across the country really, so I wish I had had that life experience. 5. What's one talent/skill you don't have but always wanted? Well there are many actually...I wish that I could draw, sing, dance and mainly I wish I could cook good. I know that I can already cook good, but I always wished that I could be like those chefs on T.V., they always know what things go good together.

Order some golf shoes, otherwise we'll never get outta this place alive...... You know when you feel sick and you think you are going to die, so you lie on the floor praying to God that if you get better you will do anything for him, you'll start going to church, and you will start helping strangers and you will stop drinking, well when exactly do you have to start doing those thing? Should it be before your next encounter with death, and your second round of "please god, if you make me feel better I will......" Does he hear us? Does he care, when your problems really aren't that big, or does he focus only on the poeple who are really in trouble? Maybe he knows that I am really not going to die so he just passes by me and moves on to the next request, and then comes back every hour or so to see if I finally feel better. Do you think he ever gets tired of hearing our empty promises? Maybe he sits there listening and when he hears specific voices he says to himself, "Oh Lord, not her/him again!" Regardless of all this I have rambled about above, I may have to leave for awhile and I may not be able to post for awhile. I am not sure when and I am not too sure for how long. But please god if you hear me, I swear I will stop honking at people driving slow infront of me.

1978 I feel old. I am 25. Usually at this time of year in the past, I was never home at night, I can still rememer how much my parents would freak that I was always out and they never used to see me. Now I am at home every night practically, and sometimes on the weekend too. I don't get it, what changed? I long for those days when sitting around with a bunch of friends smoking pot and laughing for hours at nothing was a plan for the night. Even though I refuse to still smoke pot at this age, I still wish I could go back in time atleast 3 times in the summer every year. I think I would go back to my first year out of highschool, which was 7 years ago. I remember driving around in the warm summer nights, windows open, sunroof letting in the little sun left before it sets, the music cranked and the 4 of us screaming at the top of our lungs at all the boys on Yonge Street. Oh how I long for the good times. Now if we have to get together, we have to plan it 2 weeks in advance, and were lucky if plans don't fall through because someone decided to make other plans because they seemed better. "Sunny days where have you gone....." The sad thing is is that I know things are going to change, but it won't go back to the way it used to be, it will only get worse...... "Well i guess this is growing up." - Blink 182

9 Lives Anyone? Last summer I was in a bad car accident where we were all surprised that I got out of the car without a scratch. It was a miracle how non of the full size SUV's that were behind me hit the brakes and did not hit my spinning car that was headed for the ditch. I had my first near death experince on July 14, 2002. It made me realize that life really was precious and that we really have no control over the length of it. I thought that would have been my first and last near death experience before God decided that I should be up there organizing parties for him, but it wasn't. Last night, almost one year later I had my second near death experience, this time no cars involved. I had an allergic reation to my allergy shot, ironic isn't it? Within 5 minutes of the shot, as I made my way home, I had a 4 inch by 5 inch hive on my upper left arm. I then called my boyfriend to pick me up at home to bring me back to the doctor. As I got there, my throat was beginning to itch and swell with internal hives. The dr saw me and immediatley gave me a shot of adrenaline followed by a shot of Benadryl. As I sat there shaking like as if I was on speed or coming down from a heroin high, I realized it was happening again, I was losing control of my life. I felt helpless and I felt as though I needed to other peoples help.....and I was scared as hell. Later that night as I tried to fall asleep, I asked Him, "How many more near death experiences do I have to go through before you really come to take me?" No one answered, but I did however, see my grandmother, who past away a month and a half ago, in a dream. I wonder what that meant? Now the urlLink friday five : 1. How many times have you truly been in love? I have only been in love once. 2. What was/is so great about the person you love(d) the most? Just the way we compliment eachother and how we love eachother. 3. What qualities should a significant other have? The should be able to make you laugh when you wanna cry and they should love you no matter what, and should never try to change you. 4. Have you ever broken someone's heart? Yes, once. 5. If there was one thing you could teach people about love, what would it be? I would tell them to love with all your heart and soul, and of course I would tell them that "It is better to have loved and lost, then not to have loved at all."

Why do you need this information? Has anyone else's blooger post page changed to this weird looking one I am using now? Anyway, I am here at work today and I am barley working. I am listening to the urlLink radio and looking on the net for hotels in Manhattan New York for the weekend of October 3 to the 6th, let me rephrase that, I am looking for CHEAP hotels in Manhattan for that weekend. I have found nothing. I even tried the Holiday Inn Martinique on Braodway (I stayed there the last time I visited for a week in August in 2000) and it is quoting $189.50 UD for each night that we are there. That means that I am looking at atleast $300.00 CD a night. Come on now that is $150.00/night for 3 nights each person. I cannot afford $450.00 on hotel alone and then be expected to go shopping and come back with atleast 2 pairs of Seven Jeans, 1 funky trendy handbag in a small boutique in SoHo, 2 pairs of pointy boots (black and brown), running shoes, and casual shoes when I have to spend that kinda money on a hotel. I know, I know all of you who are reading this are thinking "Hey why do you HAVE to buy all these things?" , but if you have never been to New York then you don't understand, and if you have been and still don't understand, well then I am afraid you have no sense of style and you are a big loser. Ok, I am sorry, that is going to far, I take it back, your not losers, nor are you big ones either. But I am just bitter, just upset and just annoyed with the ridiculous costs in the US ever since 9/11. Now I am not putting anyone in the US down for this, I understand your hike in prices since then to try and rebuild the beautiful city we know as New York and The Big Apple, I blame those god damn bastards who thought it was a good idea to kill thousands of innocent people for nothing but revenge on a president or better yet on a government. Again I am sorry for the venting but till this day it makes me cry looking at footage from that horrible day. Reading stories of woman and men who have had to pick up where they left off and start a life without there husband or wife, or better yet there fiance. It breaks my heart and I am MAD till this day that this had to happen. But I must digress... So today is my friday, I am off to IKEA tomorrow for a mini shopping spree. Have a great weekend all!

But dude, I don't like girls.... So I am back at work today and I am sick. I haven't spoken to any of my co-workers. I have a VERY sore throat and it hurts to breath. I finally fell asleep last night at 4:45am and woke-up at 7:40am. I am on only merely 3 hours of sleep. I think I can fall asleep any minute now. So your probably wondering how my long weekend was, well it was fun. I spent the days driving around town, running arronds. looking at my digital camera on the shelf of Best Buy and dreaming about the day I will finally own it. The nights were spent hanging out with my friend and my cousin. Thursday we went to a bar where I had a (no joke) 47 yr old man come ask me out for his 48yr old friend who stood in the background smiling at me and holding his fanny pack around his waist. We never laughed so hard. Saturday night was another weird evening. We went to another bar downtown where we ran into old friends from highschool. In a conversation between my bestfriend and an old friend of hers dating and timing came up and they joked about her meeting someone at 1:30am that night. We walked back to the back of the bar where we were before we ran into these friends and she began to talk to a guy who she also knew. His friend asked me if she had a boyfriend cause his friend had been interested in her for a while now. This was at 1:29am. We spoke to them for about 30 minutes before me and his friends decided that it was time to let them know that they were both interested in one another. At 2:15 am they had exchanged #'s. We stummbled in at about 3:45am. I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. She fell asleep at about 6am, after rehashing the nights events and thinking about all the things I used to tell her about fate. I think I may have been right. The rest of my weekend consisted of me cleaning up, cooking dinner for friends and visiting my grandmother at the cemetery. This always makes me cry. I guess it's the guilt I feel ever since she passed away in April. I don't know when I will get over this. Later on yesterday night we searched my messy (and in the middle of being renovated) basement for my sister's highschool yearbook, to look up the guy from the night before. We couldn't find them at first. Instead we stummbled across a box of all my old toys, which included 2 pairs of pink ceramic ballet slippers. None of the 3 of us ever took ballet. I swear the 2 of us laughed so hard I peed my pants a little. That's when I realized I have 3 very different girl friends, and that she was the only one I could do things like this with. Good time...I miss them. Someone's feet reek in here today. I think I am going to vomit from the smell. God help us.

X-Games 9 I am in an all day meeting today on the 6th floor. At times it crossed my mind to jump out the window in hopes that I would land on my feet to get out of this meaningless and pointless meeting. But opted not to. The windows don't open and they are dar to thick to try and break through. I would probably bounce off the window and land on my ass and have to explain to everyone what the hell I was trying to do and why. Which in turn would make the person giving the meeting feel worthless and boring. Yesterday night I couldn't breath very well. My asthma was acting up and I sounded like Malcom friend in the wheelchair who has asthma and takes a breath after every word he said. At about 11 my boyfriend called me as he got home to ask me if I missed him. I didn't cause he was over for dinner for my mom's birthday, but I said yes, because I know that is what I would want to hear. He giggled and told me he realized how much his night sucked without me there and how he missed spending the nights with me. I felt all warm and fuzzy inside while he told me this, I never heard him say things like this to and now I finally knew how he felt when I told him all these things. It's nice to be loved. Today is my Friday. I am off tomorrow and the real Friday. I took 2 vacation days to just chill and relax and rest my wrists. I have an interview again tomorrow morning at 10. I am excited, it is with a car dealership in there office. If I get the job, I am sure that in a couple of years I will get a deal on a BMW, Rangrover, Volkswagon or Acura if I wanted to purchase a new one. Wish me luck (again) this one seems really good. Have a good weekend west coast friends. See you monday.

Just because... Today is July 17th....summer is half way over, and I have done nothing that can make me say, come september, "what an F***ing amazing summer!!!" nothing of that sort. All I have been doing is staying in and chillin out on the couch at night contemplating leaving this awful job. I remember when past summers consisted of screaming at the top of our lungs off of balcony's or out of car windows as we cruised downtown. Dancing with lesbian in a gay bar cause two of your close friends want you to experience their gay lifestyle with them, followed by a semi-drunk drive home with pit stops to get food, to puke or just to catch your breath from laughing so hard at something stupid your bestfriend just did or just said. I miss these days. I want this summer to be like those past ones where we didn't care what time it was, we didn't want the nights to end, and we wished the summer could last forever. I called my "bestfriend" this morning and told her about all of this and she said, and I quote, "those weren't all summer adventures really, they are just things we did in the past when we were dumber and just plain silly. but you grow up and things change and you have different adventures and different priorites." But I disagree, I don't have different priorites, I don't think I have ever really had any to begin with.....and I don't want different adventures, I want fun ones, not boring ones that consist of me looking for furniture, that's not fun nor an adventure. I miss "stalking" ex boyfriends, trying to see if life went on without me, I miss looking for that guy my friend has a crush on, so that we can just "accidently" end up in the same bar/club as him. I seriously didn't think that blowing out 25 candles this year meant that I was going to grow up. I thought picking out a wedding dress would mean I was growing up a little bit. Me and one of my close friends always said that we could see the two of us partying till we were 30, having a blast, drinking every night, never getting to bed before 3:30am, regardless of the fact that we had to be up by 7 the next morning. Now I barley see him or speak to him....he is too busy.....I don't get it, is it just me? Am I the only one who doesn't want to grow up yet? Am I the only one who wants to use these 3 months of summer as a way of making great memories and great stories to tell the grandchildren? Am I? Am I really alone on this??

Why does your Honda Civic sound like a race car?? Today when I was driving to work I realized that one year ago today I almost died in car accident. It was pretty bad, no one could figure out how me and my friend walked out of the car without a scratch, and till this day it remains a mystery. That day I vowed (once I was over the shock of the whole situation) that I would live life to the fullest and that I would say whatever I want to say, do whatever I want to do, and so on. I haven't. It's been one year and I still am at a job I hate (I know I have said this way to much now) and I still don't do whatever I want, cause if that was the case I would have got up and walked out of here earlier this morning when I was VERY pissed off. I seriously think that I can no longer post positive things while I am here. I may have to stop posting till I find a new job.

Sunrise, Sunset I applied for 2 jobs today. Both payroll and both seem better than what I am doing here. I guess I can focus on the other things I want to do with my life, like writing the best american novel, and my photography. The other one seems like it would be just as good, 5 days a week and about a 10 minute drive from my house. Good times, I hope I get one of them. In other news, it's cloudy here today and it is putting everyone in either a bad mood, a lazy mood, or a rotten one. I happen to be in all 3 as per usual...and it's busy here for a Thursday and I don't like that. It means that I can't do all the other things I want to do, like go online and look for jobs.

Back to where I went wrong... Last night I was driving around my city looking for a store to buy the newspaper so that I could look at there classified section for a new job, or even an idea for a career that I can take some courses on. It was such a beautiful night, as the sun was setting the sky was pink, red and purple and it just made me love summer even more. It made me think that I have to take advantage of these sunsets casue come winter there is no sun to set, and on the odd day that the sun does come out, when it is setting I am still at work, and when I get home at 5pm it felt like midnight and I always had the thought in the back of my head to be in bed. But last night as I was driving I heard a song that made me think of life, my life, and also made me think about change and how I don't really accept it very well. I hate drives like that, ones that make me think when I don't really feel like thinking at that point in time. And I don't really mean hate, I guess I love those drives really cause they force me to deal with things. Day by day I try to think of things to get me through these changes and help me except things once they are no longer. I was watching t.v and I heard someone say something about change and how things can never be the same, and it hit me and it made a lot of sense, they said; "Change is good and it can also be hard, but it's inevitable, so it's important that when you move forward, you try not to look back too much." And they were right. I know what my problem is, I don't want to things to change, I don't want to grow up, I don't want to stop having the fun you can only have with your friends between the ages of 18-23. I want it all to last forever. But alas, I realize that it can't and now it is time for me to move on.

So I wanna cry...what now.... No seriously I do.... I am really getting tired of this place, I really HATE my job. I have nothing else really to say because it will only be negative. I will post hopefully sometime soon......for now I can't.

You gotta go there to come back.... I thought it was pretty cool when I heard it this morning on the radio, it is the title for the urlLink Sterophonics new album that comes out in Canada sometime soon, but I am thinking of making it the title of the book that I am writing. It's basically about something like that.....having to actaully go through something to come out a better person....like having to go to hell and back to realize things are just fine the way they are. I am not 100% sure about the books actaul storyline, but I am hoping that it's going to be a good one. Something that people can read and be like "hey, i know exactly what you mean", or maybe they can be like "wow, what a crazy fun adventure that was." somthing that people can relate too, the kind of book I would like to read. But I realized that when you are trying to write the best american novel while living in Toronto, you either have to do a lot of research or you have to pick up your shit and actually venture out there. Unfortunatley due to the lack of money I have opted to research via internet. Hopefully this book will make it to your hands, hopefully this book will actually have an ending, unlike the other 5 stories I have tried to write. My only problem is that I hate critisism, and I hate having to hear bad things about my work from people I know, adn I hate when people I know read my stuff, that's why I am considering putting another name on the book.....kinda like a stage name....

Dude I have noticed something really strange over the past couple of days, I have been using the word "Dude" more often than needed or even necessary, then I realized that it is never really necessary, nothing really is. But it seems that I have been confusing people by using this word cause I have never used it and now that I am I guess they are seeing me in a different light, a brighter one nonetheless. Well enough about that, I was of yesterday for Canada's Birthday, also my sisters, and all I did was relax on the porch and ponder life. Then I started to get depressed so I got up and went for a drive. I drove by all the place that I used to hang out with friends when we were younger and when no one had a car to go downtown with. It was weird, yet enlightening to see that our old spots were now being occupied by kids that would be about the same age we were when we made those places our home away from home. It reminded me that life goes on, we do get older, but our memories are what we have to hold on to this part of our lives. A way to relive the past. But as I drove past these places and back to my front porch I was sad to see that these times did pass and that now all we could do was look back on old pictures and remember the good time. But that was when it hit me. I realized some underlining issue I had and have always had, I can't deal with change, it frightens me and it makes me regress back to my childhood ways. It is a big concerne for me, I have realized that everytime my life made a change toward the "next big step", I would freak out. I have no way to control this and I fear that as my life progresses and all the necessary changes be made, I will once again regress back into the way I was and not move forward at all. I will forever be stuck at 19, and for some reading this you think it is a good thing, but my friends as I live through it, I can surely tell you that it is not......

Heaven is a half pipe Today is my last day of work before the nice long weekend, and to top it off I am leaving work at 1:30pm cause I have an appointment.....oh ya..... This weekend, marking the end of summer always makes me nostalgic for the summers from the past. I usually sit on the porch late monday night as the sun begins to set and just soak up the last few minutes of summer. It usually gets really cold the following day and lasts late into the next week. Sometime around the 15th we'll get a week of Indian Summer, and we'll have BBQ's, head to the cottage, wash our cars and cruise around town with the windows down and the music blarring. Everyone is in better spirits from the heat. They laugh again, their back in shorts, tank tops and flip flops. They let you pass ahead of you on the freeway with a smile and wave back at you when you thank them. Something about the heat and sun in mid to late septmeber that reminds people that we don't have to rush, we don't have to be mean and that we can be ourseleves. But come October, when the sun starts to set at 7:30 and then 5:30 sometime in November, people become bitter and cynical and hate everything. Christmas time usually brings spirts back up, but not always. The mall parking lots are packed and the stores are filled with frantic shoppers. We all forget what it was like to be a kid and we all forget how great things were in the summer. I think remembering only brings more pain. I think being nostalgic isn't for everyone. I think pushing the past far out of their heads is a better pass time. Not for me. Without the past, without my memories, I would be bitter and cynical. I would hate the world everyday of the week. It's too bad people don't embrace this long weekend more. It's too bad not everyone sits on the porch or in a car and just listens to music watch the sunset and just thank God that they had an amazing past. For this summer to will be in the past and soon forgotten and we will begin the grumpy and nasty state of mind that can only be found in the Fall. What are you doing this long weekend? And an extended HAPPY BIRTHDAY Kat this weekend. I won't be here tomorrow, so here it is today....

Fate vs. Veal Cutlets I wonder sometimes, is there such thing as fate. Cause really when you think about it, it sounds quite ridiculous. Take me for example, I was a firm believer in fate, especailly when I got together with my boyfriend, the way things happen you would think it was fate. But then yesterday as I sat on my friends porch as she washed her car, I began thinking crazy things. Like, was it planned out for me to prefer a G-string to a thong? Was it planned out for me to have a job with no direction that forces me to cringe at the thought of coming here ever day? Was it fate for me to have an obsession with shoes and with bags? Was it fate, when my sister had a miscarrage in between my nephew and niece? Was it fate for me to LOVE summer and evidently end up living in a country that only offers 2 months of it? I ask this because I really think it is weird if while I was in the process of being made for 9 months some 25 years ago, that the dear Lord above was making this list. Is it just me, or is someone else out there wondering why they like certain things and hate other things and why you prefer a nice hamburger over a veal cutlet.

I remember it well... Last nights conversation, somewhere between Belview Ave and Glitter Cres: Me: So why am I coming to get ice cream with you again? Her: Because.....hey there is Jerry's crazy brother.... Me: Where? I don't see his creepy stalker car.. Her: No he's in a truck...ill with my crazy neighbour... Me: Who? Horse's husband? Me: Or the fat bald dude that walks around spitting phlem on peoples lawns? Her: No, laughs , the other one who lives at the end of my street.. Her: I have a lot of crazy people on my street.. Me: Ya it's kinda scary... Me: Maybe you should consider moving.... Her: Me!?! Never........ I think it was about 2 years ago this past May that I visited Vancouver BC and Victoria BC . It was the second time that I had been out west (the first time being Vegas) and I was on a 3 hour time difference. I hated it. I used to wake up at 6am BC time because it was 9am Toronto time. I would take naps halfway through the day just so I wouldn't fall asleep during dinner. The same went for my 4 days in Vegas. But this one day in Victoria, where an old friend of ours was living for school, we went out all day and then came back to the hotel only to shower and the head out to grab dinner and drinks with his friends that he had made living there for the past 3 years. That night, I remember it was a Thursday, they took us to a club after dinner where we drank, got drunk and danced on top of speakers to my bestfriends favorite song. We stayed there till about 3 am and then headed to a local sub shop and grabbed a sandwich and told stories about Toronto and all the stupid things we did there. It wasn't till about 4am that the 4 of us stummbled into our hotel room and passed out on the beds, making it the first time I was ever up for 24 hours. Back in toronto it was 7am, (my boyfriend at the time called me as he was getting ready for work to tell me that his ex-girlfriend called him, who does that anyway?), so technically, I was up for 25 hours. Good time was had by all. I miss those days. I wish I had more of them here in Toronto. I remember it well.

Off Air I have no music playing in the background today. Everytime I try to log on to my favorite station, it tells me it is off air. This makes me mad. Believe it or not, I can't concentrate without music in the background. I have a radio sitting at the top of my cubical, but you can't get a signal in here if your life depended on it, as does my work. Someone quit here today. I envy her. I wish I could quit. Well I can, however she has a new job. If I quit today I will be unemployed, and we all know how much that sucks. Besides if I quit today I will no longer have access to the internet, causing this site to remain empty, lifeless and dead. I can't let that happen and I can't get the internet at home. It's to expensive and my laptop is too slow, well it's still good, but not good enough. I need a desktop for my home. I also need a carpet, couch, coffee table, VCR/DVD player and side table for the room in the basement that I am to furnish to my liking so I have a place to call my own, other than the cramped space I call a bedroom. My thoughts wonder a lot. When my phone rings here at my desk, I transfer it to the next unsuspecting customer care rep to handle the call. I have taken about 15 calls since I got in this morning at 8:30am. I usually take about 35 by this time. I have nothing to really blog about today. I am bored, I am tired and CSI: Miami was a repeat that I have already seen last night. I went out with my friend to watch her eat a hot fudge ice cream from McD's. I have lunch in 1 hour and 15 minutes. It is only for 30 minutes. Which gives me enough time to heat up my leftovers, walk back to my desk and log back in to "take" calls. There are 2 calls holdong right now, wait, make that 1. I don't want to answer either, I just want to get up and go home to sleep or lay in the back on my deck and take in some sun. This post is boring. See what happens when I have no music.

Strange days For the past few mornings I have been waking up with this nervous, anxious, scared feeling in my stomach. I wake-up in a sweat with my purple bed sheets sticking to my legs, my hair is a mess and my pillows on the floor. The room however is cool, dark and the blinds are pulled down from when my mom walked into my room at 1am to make sure that the sun won't seep in in the early morning and wake me up. My pajama pants are tossed to the otherside of the room and covering my blue and white PUMA flip flops that I bought 2 summers ago. Next to that, are my favorite pair of Seven jeans I bought when I had to go to a party that got cancelled and then headed out to a club that was filled with whinny blondes and greasy "studs" that paid too much attention to our tits and ass. Underneath my jeans is a purse filled with tickets, lipsticks, a pack of gum, lose change and a pack of matches from a resturant I ate at 6 months ago. There are no matches missing, all 14 are still in place, the cover however, creased and faded from many nights of being dropped, trusseled and thrown into the truck while living in my purse. They may very well never be used. I don't smoke. I never have except for those 3 summers I spent lounging by pools and sleeping on park benches and smoking pot. Summers that were never really there and that never really happend, or so we tell ourselves when we remember stupid things we had done and now regret. Near the door are my favorite black pointy shoes that have placed a blister on my right pinky toe that throbs with pain and unleashes memories from the hours spent dancing, standing at the bar making small talk with strangers and buying drinks for everyone. On my dresser is my license and a phone number from a guy named "Paul" that I took to pass on to my friend who thought he was hot and then passed out on the couch in the back corner of the club. The room is silent and I wake up in a panic and shoot up right in my bed. I look around, smell the air, look out to see the sun rising outside and see that the clock is reading 5:23am. I lay back down, close my eyes and try to think happy thoughts. But I can't. I try to remember why my foot hurts, why there is make up smugged on my white pillow and why I am sleeping in half of last nights outfit. I can't keep a steady train of thought. I can't remeber all the fun I had, all the laughs and all the running we did to get to the pizza parlour before it closed at 4am. All I can think of is the anxious feeling in my stomach, the paranoid feeling in my gut, and the reoccuring fear in my head. Everynight it's the samething. It has been for the past week. It is having that pre first day of school gitters at the age of 25. It really only is the pre fall gitters that I always associate with the first day of school and I have been since I have been working in "the real world". It's the glum look on friends and strangers faces that tells me they are thinking the samething. Summer is almost over and time is passing way more quicker than any of us expected. I read about this stuff on other peoples sites and I think to myself that I am not alone, but it doesn't make me feel any better. But that's not the only thing running through my head when I go to sleep. It's the lingering bills that need be paid. The parties I have to plan and help pay for. The gifts I have to give. The life I want to live. Although that sounded like a song in the way that it rhymed, it really is something important. It's having to finally deicide what I have to do with it. Should I make those pre fall gitters back into pre first day of school gitters? Should I embark on a whole new life all on my own? Or should I bring someone along for the ride? It's questions that I ask myself when no one is around to hear. I wait for answers but they never come. So I spend my time making lists of things I have to do now and in the near future. Near the bottom of each list is the same task, that reads, "Take a trip across the states and leave a piece of your past and pick up a piece of your future in every town and city you pass." I know it will get better, I know I will someday forget about the fears and learn how to let go of the past, but till then, I look forward to sleepless nights, more blisters and a digital camera.

Light's go out and I can't be saved...... Thursday August 14th, 2003, I left work for the day at 4pm and told everyone I would see them Friday like I do everyday before I leave. I drove home on the 407 and everything was great, the sun was shinning, my current favorite songs were playing on the radio and there was not a lot of traffic. I was happy and I couldn't wait to get home and sit on the porch soaking in the sun. While I drove my music listening was interupted by static and "other" stations coming through on that frequency. I was confused. The radio station I listen to is based in Toronto so I never had a problem with the frequency, so I put the volume higher then lower and then higher again, each time only leading me to different stations. At this point I was convinced my car antenna fell off somewhere on the highway. So I kept on driving, hoping that the signal would pick-up eventually and I could go on enjoying my late afternoon drive. I exited the highway a few kilometers later with a police officer next to me. The traffic lights at that exit were out. The officer turned, so did I. The next set of lights were out, so we went back to a four way stop mode, everyone taking their time through the intersection so not to be hit by an idiot driving at a warp speed. As I drove to my house I had to pass another set of 4 traffic lights that were out aswell. At this point I would have been shitting my pants if no one else was on the road with me, everything was eary and it seemed as though the world had come to a screeching halt. Finally, the radio annoucer came back on the air and said how the power was out downtown, and how it effected all of Ontario, New York, Ohio, Washington and Detriot. I went home sat on the porch, suntanned and then freaked out when I realized that the television didn't work and that it wasn't going to for the rest of the night. So I called up some friends and they all came over to my place and hung out all night in the dark, we spoke of the "old days", up coming concerts, the blackout, the fact that none of us had any gas in our cars and that no one had cigarettes or cold beer. It was nice to be with friends you haven't seen in a while. Everyone cleared out at about 1 am and I headed to bed with a candle and a flashlight. I couldn't fall asleep. I am used to falling asleep with the t.v. on or some sort of light and without it I couldn't get to sleep. I finally fell asleep at about 2:15am and slept through till the morning when I woke-up to my alarm clock flashing 4:36am, it was really 9am. I breathed a sigh of relief that the power was back on and called work to tell them I wasn't going to be in. The power was on for the rest of the weekend, except for Saturday night when it went out again at 1am and returned Sunday morning at 7:30am. It was this weekend that I realized how having power is a BIG FRICKIN' deal. I felt helpless and I felt out of control. These are the 2 things I hate feeling the most. I think the biggest thing was not knowing when the power was going to come back on, and when I could finally make myself a cup of long overdue coffee. I also had to live without A/C this weekend cause we were told to conserve energy by not washing clothes, running the A/C and using lights when you don't need to, because we were still in "A State of Emergency". I had to wait 45 minutes friday afternoon for gas. Ya, I waited, I had nothing else to do. Apparently we are still at risk of losing power again and we are to again conserve energy this week. I am here at work frezzing my ass off in a long sleeve shirt because the building manager decided to CRANK THE FUCKING A/C!!!!!!!!!!! I hope the power goes out in this building so I can go home. I hate this place. Have I told anyone lately? Well now you know. Well that was my powerless weekend, how was yours?
