I just have to figure out now when it starts......hmmm....I think I will just start in September........ya back to school, yup sounds good, everyone else has a new beginning, why can't I?

Swing Swing.... Yesterday was one of the hottest days in August, it was about 38 degrees which (for my american friends) is about 101 degrees, but it's not the dry heat you would find in the Nevada desert or the Hilton poolside in Las Vegas, it's the sticky, humid, nasty kind you would find in LA. I swear I was literally sweating from head to toe, and guess what, lucky me got to make BBQ for the family as they worked inside the house with the A/C cranked all the way up. As I stood there infront of the BBQ, with a temprature that read, 550 degrees, so frickin hot that I need not convert for my american friends, flipping steaks and cooking ribs and snacking on already cooked lamb, I felt for the first time, sweat dripping down my calves from my knees. I have never had my knees sweat, I looked down at my khacki capri's and realized that I looked as though I had just pissed myself.... it's times like these I am glad we BBQ in the backyard..... . At one point I think I became dillusional from the heat, that I swear I heard the ribs talking to me..... Later that night I went to watch my friends football game, they lost.....they are now out of the playoffs.....till next time. Also last night I found out that a friend of a friend passed away in a car accdient Monday afternoon. Turns out that he was drving southbound on the highway and an 18 wheeler that was going NORTHBOUND ripped through the gaurdrail and rammed right into his front end, killing him instantly. I later found out that he was engaged to be married next summer. That's when I began to cry. This is one thing that I have never been able to understand or ever will be able to understand. Why do people have to die at young age, let alone die months before their wedding? Think of the poor fiance left behind to pick up the pieces and move on without the person they thought they were going to spend the rest of their life with. I don't get it. How could something horrible like this happen, something so devistating like this, while killers, stalkers and rapists walk the street health and harmful. Why not kill them off? Why not kill off the people who planned the 9/11 attacks? Why give a 6 month year old cancer? Why kill someone's fiance in a car accident, or better yet at their desk in the office checking email as a 747 rams into the building? Why do any of this? And please do not add in the always repeated, seldom true saying, "what doesn't kill you makes you stonger", because I know that if something happened to my boyfriend, niece or nephews I would die. So I guess it won't make me stronger. It's times like these I question God's existence, his love and his great big plan.

A little bit of miscommunication I finally mustered up the nerve to ask my boss today what I had to ask him, and he said yes. No questions asked. I explained everything I had to to him and he just looked at me and said, "Sure!". So I got up and walked out of his office happy. I went to sit down back at my desk and I realized, 'wait, that was to easy he must have understood something else and he expects something different from me.' So I spoke to my supervisor and told her what happen and she also thinks he misunderstood. So she is in there talking to him right now as we speak. Now the fear is back. Now I am scared that they will say no and all my dreams have to be put on hold, and put on the back burner once again. Only to be forgotten about in a few months and make thier way on to my "Shoulda Woulda Coulda" List, a list that already has about 35 items, and I am only 25.

Confessions of a would be Beauty School Drop-out May 16th, 1996. I was in the backseat of my good friend's green cavalier in the parking lot of my high school and we were planning our prom and graduation. I planned on wearing a black dress to prom (which I did) and then crash at the hotel with all my friends (which we also did). As for after graduation, I planned on working for the summer and waiting to hear back from my colleges of choice. I had applied to 2 colleges for 2 different things; Journalism and Marketing. One summer night in mid July after hearing that a woman journalist went missing after being called at 3am to report a story, I decided I would not go into broadcasting or journalism. Right now you are probably thinking it was because I was afraid of all weird things that lurk in the middle of the night that I may be called to report on, and I have to interupt your thought process here, cause it wasn't the reason. The real reason I decided not to was the fact that she was called at 3am to report something, and I am not the type of person to put their lives on hold just incase I had to go out to report something, I wasn't the type of person you could call at 3am if you weren't drunk and just trying to make me laugh with your random mid morning harrasment call. So when those schools accepted me, I said "No thanks kind sir, I am off to pursue a career in Marketing." Later that week I got accepted into those schools aswell and I decided that come September I would be studying all the great things that come with the world of Marketing. So Septmeber came, and my first, second and third day passed. Day four came, and I dropped out. I hated it. What the hell do I care about the Economics and Accounting side of making commercials that spoke to people, made them laugh, made them care, but most of all made them think? It was then I realized I should have been in Advertising. But what did I know I was only 18 yrs old and my school's guidance counselor wasn't much help. All she did all day was bitch about her kids with all the other people who worked in the office and pretend to check the system when you wanted to change a course and only tell you that somehow it's already "full". So needless to say, I made a mistake when I applied to college. I then, after dropping out of Marketing 101, decided to join the "real" world and put my education on the back burner. That was 1996, I was 18, it is now 2003 and I am 25. Do I have any regrets? Yes, many. What I realize now is that I missed out on an important part of growing up. I missed Pub Night, I missed sleeping over at a friends dorm after studying till 5 am for an exam, I missed making college friends, I missed out on great stories of staying up late during exams getting drunk instead of studying cause you knew you were already passing with an 80. I missed having a grade point average, I missed out on "Back to school" sales and "back to school" gitters. But most of all, I missed graduating with a degree in something meaningful, and for that I feel like I have nothing to be proud of, and I know I don't. I have nothing that I can say to myself when things get tough, "Hey, you can do this, you got through 3 years of college studying (Insert degree here)! This is nothing compaired to that torture!" All I have is 6 years working in the "real" world experience working in a job I hate and in a career I was never really made for. I guess I do have something to offer, advise on "What not to do with your life". It's better than nothing I guess.

Where do I begin? I am afraid. I am in pain. Mostly I am afraid. I have to ask my boss something that I have a feeling she will say no to and all my dreams will be flushed down the toilet. So I keep putting it off so that I don't have to hear her say no and so that I won't be in a miserable mood for the rest of my life, and yes this is something that will effect my whole entire life, my whole existence. I don't know what to do. People keep saying go ask her, you have nothing to lose. But I do, I will lose all motivation to get up in the morning. Well enough about that. Flying Solo It's not what you think. I am not single again. So boys, sorry for the 2 seconds possibility of dating me :) But no, my title comes from having plans, setting goals and not having anyone to share them with. Well, I have people to share them with, like friends, family and my boyfriend and of course the random visitors to this page. But for once I don't want to. Why? you ask. Well I find that everytime I publisize my ideas, my hopes, my dreams and even my goals, they all fall short of ever even happening. They either don't get started, or I freak out at the halfway mark, get scared and run off screaming leaving all my hopes and aspirations lying there on a mud filled lawn somewhere on Yonge St. between Wellsley and Gerrard. So because of this I have opted to keep them to myself not tell anyone and if they notice they notice. If not then I guess once things are all in order, once I have passed the halfway mark, I will publish this new "me" and you will all know and you will all be able to leave your random thoughts and make your negative comments. People will only try to discourage me. My family, well my parents, will tell me not to because of financal issues, a friend who shall remain nameless will put down the idea out of sheer jealousy and jealousy only. All the points she would make would be invalid to my life and she will only aggrivate the ulcer in my stomach. Then there are a few others, well 2 others, that have supported every thought and every dream of mine since I began having them. One being someone who these days is proving me wrong about who really is my "true" best friend. She is someone who would probably replace my current best friend in the running for my maid of honor one day. No matter what I think or say, she is always there saying "Go for it, just go ahead and do what you want, who cares what others think, it's your life!" . And for that I love her to death. You know who you are, so thank you. Then there is J, my boyfriend, who always tells me that I can do whatever I want and that no matter what he is behind me 100%. He even tells me that if my parents fears come ture and I fail miserably finacially, he will support me and that he makes enough money for the both of us to be perfectly fine. (Although it bugs me that he does make good cash, I have to admit it is true.) So I guess that is why I am flying solo. There are a few here who stop by every once and awhile to read my posts and you know who you are and you to are on the "Supportive List", so thanks chicks!!! Now I am off to make some decisions, make some lists and get thing approved. Hopefully good times are ahead. I guess we'll have to wait and see. For now, I am off, today, once again is my Friday. I am off for a long weekend again. Actually I have every Friday off in August, except for the next one which is only a half day, nonetheless a semi long weekend. Have a GREAT weekend all!!!!!

"Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" This is a question that has plauged me for many years now. Showing up in random converstaions in bars, in interviews and also in the public bathroom stall in the lobby of the Las Vegas Hilton Hotel. I hate this question. When asked, my brain completely shuts down, I freeze up and I am left standing there with a dumb founded look on my face, a look that seems to appear more often then needed or welcomed. It is a question that makes me look deep down inside my soul and see that all I am thinking about that is soulful is the question that always pops in my head, "Are they ever gonna make a lactose free ice cream that doesn't contain traces of nuts?" , and nothing else. I can be here at work and dig deep into my soul to find that same answer, even in interviews and especially in the Hilton hotel public washroom. It will never change. My mind cannot comprehend such vast soul searching questions. I have never soul searched for any reason. I am not even sure if I have a soul left, if I remember correctly I think I sold it somewhere between Las Vegas and Arizona for a few more minutes of sleep, and I don't think I ever got it back. Nonetheless, soul or no soul, I have never been able to answer this question. In the bars I tell them, "Look dude, if you think my future includes you, forget about it now and just walk away while you still have your dignity." To the man in the stall next to me in the Hilton hotel, I told him, "Dude, your wearing a dress, but you gotta dick, there is no cocaine in the woman's bathroom." And to all the woman and men who have interviewed me over the last 7 years I have said this, "For me there is no 'plan'. I don't know where I will be in the next 5 years. I hope I have a job then and I hope that I am happy, but my life long moto, since the day I took my first breath has been, live for today and not tomorrow. I will forever believe this. I am a free spirt and no one can hold me back." Today, I still believe that and I know it will be a stong belief that I will pass on to my children. Now I ask, where do you see yourself in 5 years?

Matters of the heart Last night I was having a conversation with a few friends of mine about falling in love and finding Mr. and Ms. Right. Most of them were talking about how they were tired of looking for someone and they were tired of dating people and finding out that they really are not the ones for them. One friend of mine was telling me how he was tired of meeting girls who were money hungry and who were still into playing games. He was tired of calling girls only to find out that they were mad at him for not calling earlier and that they always wanted him to spend money on them. I believe that he also said something about giving up on finding someone. Another one of my friends finally decided to fill me in on what she really has been feeling lately. It turns out she was "tired of all the bullshit" that comes with dating. She was tired of giving out her number to men who asked for it and she was especially tired of going out with them a few times and then not hearing from them ever again. We both are in awe over this. She is a very down to earth girl, who is beautiful and not only on the inside, she is equally, if not more beautiful on the outside. She doesn't play games, she won't smother you cause she wants you to have your own life and still this girl has trouble keeping men. And I know I heard her say that she was definitely giving up on love, and to be honest, I didn't blame her. One night while we were out she met someone, and they hit it off, he has yet to call her, but she doesn't care because in the back of her head, this already didn't work out. Which makes me wonder, when do we let down our guard and how do we know it's the right time to do so?

Caller ID Blocked In the past when famous people, actors, actresses and singers, have passed away, I never fully understood how and why people who only knew them through their movies or music cried when they heard the news. Well that all changed last Friday morning when I heard that John Ritter died. I can't even put it in words the feelings I was going through, the confusion, the denial and finally the sadness. It was as if I just received a phone call telling me that an old friend died. But that was it, an old friend did pass away. To me friends aren't only the people you can see and touch and be close to. To me friends are the people who come into your life and leave you with a nice feeling, or a lesson or even just an ache in your stomach from laughing so hard. And that was exactly what John Ritter has done for me. He showed me that life doesn't always have to be an up hill climb or a struggle, he showed me that life should be lived to the fullest everyday, but most of all he taught me how to laugh. It was Three's Company that was the first comedy I had ever watched at such a young age. He will be missed. I think if he wasn't on television these days on 8 Simple Rules, I think it would have been a bit easier to deal with his death, but to have one of the funniest people alive brought back into your life again, only to be taken away a mere 2 seasons in, well that something I have only been able to speak about now, nearly 7 days later. It's too bad that my niece and nephews won't have the privilege of seeing him at his best.

It's times like these you learn to live again.... As I drove into work today, all the radio stations were all talking about the samething, the obvious choice of conversation was on the 2 year anniversary that is today. It was hard not to get a lump in my throat as I listened to them while I drove. I realized this morning that it's been 2 years since someone's mother or father passed away. It's been 2 years since an elderly woman waited by the phone to hear from her son who lives on the Upper West Side. It's been 2 years since they waited for their friends and family to come running out of the towers before they came crumbling down. It's been 2 years since she lost her fiance, and she still doesn't feel like she can move on. It's been 2 years since he lost his new wife who was carrying their first child. It's been 2 years that I realized that life is precious and that we have to take full advantage of the time we have because we never know when we will be called away. It's been 2 years and I still please everyone else before I please myself.

Football, Football and wait, more football..... In Toronto most of our main roads are 3 paved lanes running in each direction. In the far right lane you can always be sure to find a car going 30kms/hour in a 60 zone and everyone behind that car is just fine cruising at that LOW speed. In the centre lane, you can always find people doing the exact speed constantly, only slowing down when someone from the far right lane makes a mistake and comes into the centre lane. And then there is the Left Lane , also known as "IF YOUR IN THIS LANE YOU BETTER HAVE YOUR FOOT ON THE FUCKIN GAS AT ALL TIMES" , where you can be sure that if the speed is 100km/hour they are doing atleast 130 in that lane. Now the thing here in Toronto and even Canada, you know that the left lane is used only by those comfortable enough to drive anywhere between 120-160kms/hour, but it never fails that some moron from the right lane comes all the way over to the left lane to continue their slower than ass speed, and I shit you not, they never learn from this mistake. If and when you decide to make your way into the centre lane going slow, and cut someone off going the exact speed limit that person will be fine with it, they will simply reduce their speed and wait for you to move once you realized you made a mistake, but in the left lane, well then brace yourself. Not only will they honk at you, but they come so close up your ass that you think they are coming right through your car, and if you don't get out of the way, they will. You wonder how do I know all of this, well I witnessed this this morning on my drive in to work and I am one of the Left Lane Fuckers, yup I am as agressive as drivers come here in Canada and I would not be afraid to drive in downtown Manhattan if given the chance. I swear if one other idiot person does this...... Other than that, I am sick. Today I have no voice and I also have a sinus infection that the dr as given me horse pills to take to get rid of this hidious infection that he told me has plauged my sinus cavaty for 5 years now, so this means no drinking, cause the last time I was stupid enough to do that I passed out after 3 drinks, yup that night I was a cheap date and a huge lush, something I am no proud of. But this weekend when we hit the clubs I opted to be the designated driver and remain sober while everyone around me drank the night and their problems away. Now I am back at work and regret not passing out this weekend.

Shake Ya Tailfeathers I am back baby! Where did I go you ask? No where really, I was just off for a 4 day weekend and now I am back to work and I am glad that I am here. Well I am not really, but I think reverse psycology will work on my right about now. So school started yesterday, my nephew went into Grade 1 and he is loving it! I was even surprised to hear that when he found out his bestfriend was in the other class he was ok with it. Good for you Michael, be independent from a young age, you'll understand why later. Long weekend was this past weekend here and now as I drive into work there is more traffic, I have to stop at all the school crosswalks and laugh at the kids and I have to leave my house 10 minutes earlier to make it to work on time. My allergies have been really bugging me lately and the Ragweed levels have been at an all time high of 9 (out of 10) which is the cause for all the sniffling and watery eyes, itchy nose and ears and scratchy throat which irritates me 24 hours out of the day. I can now easily say I can't wait for the fall to kick in, that is when this will all end. Wow September 3rd, is it just me or does eveyone think this summer past really fast. It seems like only last week I saw all the kids walking home from school for the last time before the summer kicked in and now I see their frowning faces walking back to school, dragging their backpacks and feet. I feel bad, I always hated school, that's probably why I never went back. So my weekend was ok, long, but ok. Friday night I went out for drinks with my friends. Saturday I had to babysit my neice and nephew and then I made dinner for me and my best friend. Then we watched a movie I rented, "What a Girl Wants" (I know gay, but whatever) and my friend was craving movie theater popcorn so we drove over to the thearter near my house and walked in bought popcorn, walked back to the car and drove home to watch the movie. Sunday I woke up early and cleaned and then went to the store to pick up decorations for my dad's surprise party next weekend, then I headed out to the mall with my friend and my boyfriend and I looked for shoes and I bought a purse. I am going back this weekend to buy the shoes, they were $138 and I convinced my boyfriend to give me half. Then I went home and made BBQ for me and my friends, watched tv and then headed out to a bar to get some drinks where we encountered a slut that broke-up my bestfriends relationship with her ex-boyfriend. We didn't start anything, instead we just drank more and called my boyfriend and his friends to come by and then pick us up so we didn't have to take a cab. Monday was pretty much a boring day, I cleaned up and then I went to see my nephew (my other one, Peter, he is 2 months old) and I hung out with him on the carpet all afternoon watching tv. Then I went home and made soup cause I felt ill, and my friend came over to keep me company, we watched Sixteen Candles on VH1 and then I went to bed and I was up till 4am puking and what not. So needless to say my weekend went out with a bang. I am now back at work still feeling ill and contemplating asking to go home early. Now the belated urlLink Friday Five : 1. On a last note, yesterday while I went to go get gas, I was standing there pumping gas and I realized that I live in one of those communities that you see on tv, kinda like the OC and like Beverly Hills 90210. Your either well off, rich or really rich. Of course I live here only cause I live with my parents, otherwise I would live in crack town or the ghetto.

The History of this Blog.....just in case you were wondering.... Hmm let's see where do I begin.....hmmmm....wait I know.....It all started back in December of 2002 when I was sitting at my desk one day frustrated with this job and it's lack of direction. I was sitting in front of my computer looking online and I was tired of looking at the same usual stuff, like urlLink Instyle.com , or urlLink MSN , and even my urlLink emails . So I typed urlLink "ihatethisplace.com" and it lead me to this bitter girls website where she spoke of things I only thought of and where she put up all her opinions whether they are good or bad. I then went to her guest book where I found other weblogs, I found this one called urlLink "everything is everything" and it belonged to this girl named Christy. It lead me to one called urlLink "Whittle Me This" who belonged to this girl Alisa. That lead me to urlLink "Me In The Corner" which belongs to Matt, the one we all know and love and laugh at his witty banter. That one lead me to a number of different ones; urlLink "The Medieval Bestseller", , urlLink "Geekjive" , urlLink "One way mirror to the Soul " and urlLink "Sarah Hatter dot com" . This one lead me to a whole bunch of fun websites like urlLink "Aubrey Sabala" , urlLink "Dooce" , urlLink "Willo O'Brien" , urlLink "Jason Killingworth" (An amazing writer by the way) and urlLink "Jane for Short" who shares my love for urlLink Phantom Planet . I read these weblogs for about a month until Jenny told me that I should create my own. And I did. I took her good advice and I am happy that I did. Through reading all these exciting, interesting, witty and intelligent weblogs I have learned a lot about some amazing people and some amazing things. I have learned a lot about the west coast and it made me realize why I really really really want, no need, to go to California. And for this, I thank you all.....

Music to my ears Last night I was watching Alias and I just love that show, even though poor Sydney is in love with someone who got married because she was missing for 2 years and he thought she was dead, (Damn you Vaughn you should have looked for her!) it's hard for me to deal with her pain, as you can see I feel it through the television. But I noticed last night, well almost every night that I watch TV, that in dramas there is always music playing the background for a scene and I have recently noticed how the music makes the scene so much better. The message impacts you more and you feel more for the character. Like last night at the end of Alias, Sydney goes back into Vaughn's hospital room to get her coat that she forgot and she see's Vaughn's new skanky whore of a wife kissing him and comforting him and you see Syd standing outside of the room with a sad look on her face, and in the background all you hear behind a soft mellow rift, "Don't worry, things will are gonna get easier soon, don't worry things are gonna get better soon....." and I just felt like I was standing in her body feeling her pain, cause I swear a tear rolled down my face when I was watching this happen. So I just want to say to the people who do this, the behind the scenes work, keep up the AMAZING work you do!! Your truly the important people on the set!

Flashbacks to places I want to be I can't believe that it is already Monday and that it is already 2:30pm. I am extremely exhausted today, I woke-up late and I still feel like I am sleeping, I think it is because of all the late nights this past weekend. Either way I will pay for this all week, since I won't be able to catch up on my sleep till Saturday. So my weekend, where to begin.....Friday I just hung out at home during the day and gave my room the cleaning that was long overdue and then Friday night I headed out downtown with friends to a club and drank and danced till about 3 in the morning and stumbled into bed at about 4am after driving home and making pit stops for food and vomiting on my friends behalf. Saturday morning I woke-up pretty early to the sound of hammering and drilling and heavy items falling to the floor. Since it was impossible to fall back asleep, I opted to get up and leave the house for the whole day. I went shopping and I went to hang out with my friend while she worked. Then I made dinner and then headed once again downtown to a club yet again. It was a different club then Friday nights club. It was actually the club I had posted about before, under my post " Regrets ". I had a lot of fun, and it was good to be back there. The smoky corner where he used to take your information for contest ballots was now filled with posters. The small room where he ran into me 2 weeks later, now played music from the 80's. The couch on the second floor where I convinced my friend not to break up with her now fiance was no longer a couch, but rather a "make-out sofa". The bartender who knew us by our drink orders quit and now works at a bar on the other side of town. The DJ booth where we used to put in our requests is now guarded by a bouncer and you have to tell him your requests and hope he doesn't mess them up. The back bar where he told me he liked me and kissed me is still run by the same witch of a bartender who pays no attention to you if you are a woman and she still enjoys flirting with the guys in hopes that they buy her a shot. The steps outside where you always were able to find me passed out gaurded by the bouncers who later became our best friends is no longer cold cement, but rather fake green grass and the sign above it now says, "NO HANGING OUT HERE, THOSE DAYS ARE LONG OVER", and the bouncers who were our best friends have now moved on to bigger and better things. And yes of course the bathroom floors still flood after 1am. When I stood at the bar, I looked around and all these memories, plus many more came rushing back as if no time had passed and I was 21 all over again. It was nice to be back there and look around and have the ghosts of the past come back and haunt us while we were sitting back on the "make-out sofa" talking and laughing about how things never seem to change.

Regrets Although many of my nights were spent yelling at the top of our lungs off my friends balcony, "No REGRETS!!", I find that in this day and age and at this point in my life, I have a few, if not many. Sure I have your basic regrets of not buying those shoes before your size was gone, or not leaving the house in time and now I find myself late again for work, or promising someone you would do them a favor only to realize there are not enough hours in the day. But these are not the regrets I am talking about. These are not the life altering things that we should have or should not have done and now you wonder where you would be today if you had made a different choice. Whether it be about moving to a certain city, or not taking that long overdue vacation, or taking that new job, at times I am sure we all sit back and wonder "what could have been". It was a Saturday night in May of 2000 and we were at a club celebrating my best friends birthday. I had been seeing this guy now for about 2 1/2 months and things were going good and I had asked him to join us at the club that night to party with us and help us celebrate her 22nd birthday. He said yes he would be there. Later that night while we were driving down he called to tell me that he had forgotten that I had invited him out and made other plans, this pissed me off. How could you forget something I told you just a few hours ago. So I hung up the phone told my friends I was pissed off, but I wasn't going to let this ruin my night, so we headed off to the club. As the night progressed there was a lot of drinking and a lot of dancing and a lot of fun being had. We were drunk, but not to the point of not knowing what was going on and not remembering in the morning, we were at the point where you would walk into the bathroom and start singing songs by NSync at the top of your lungs and then tell your friends, who by the way you see every night of the week, that they are the best and that you should hang out together more often. But needless to say we all were in a good move loving the vibe and loving life, regardless of how much an ass the guy you have been dating turns out to be, so I head over to the bar where the bartender knows us by our first names and by our favorite drinks so that I wouldn't have to wait long, because by this time the club had reached capacity and the place was jam packed. As I pushed my way to the bar, I noticed a rather handsome gentleman headed in the same direction as me, I smiled and he smiled back and we met at the bar. He looked at me and said "Holy it's gonna be a while before we get drinks." I looked back at him smiled and yelled out the bartenders name and she came right over, I asked for another rye and ginger and asked him what he wanted to drink, and I remember it was a Miller Genuine Draft, known best here as an MGD. I smiled at him and said "this ones on me!". I paid the bartender and started to walk away, he came after me and asked my name and asked if I hung out there often. I told him my name and told him he could find me here almost every weekend, he laughed and said his name was Chris. He was hot, and I mean H-O-T! We talked for a little while longer and he told me he was in a band, told me the name and told me he was playing in a music festival in a couple of weeks around various clubs in the city and invited me and my friends to go check them out. As we stood there making small talk, my friend, the birthday girl, found me and begged me to go to the bathroom with her, of course she was too drunk to go by herself so the two of us headed to the restroom and I told him I would be back and I would come look for him. He smiled and I drifted off into the crowd and made my way to help my friend out. Once we were done I found him off in the back standing around talking to his friends so I went to join them. They all seemed pretty nice and told me that I should go see their band and that I wouldn't regret it. About 10 minutes later my friends came to find me to tell me that the guy I was seeing had just showed up at the club, it was now 2:30am, he thought this would please me and show that he cared, it didn't, but I felt bad that he drove all the way downtown by himself so I stood there talking to him. A little while later Chris passed by and told me he was heading out and that I really should come see his band. I smiled and nodded and told him the next time he needed a drink badly to come find me here at the bar hanging out with my friends, he laughed and winked and walked out of my life. The next morning, as we all arose in my living room, we talked about things that had happened the night before and filled each other in on things that we didn't remember. I told them about Chris and about his band, but I couldn't remember the name of the band or where they were playing. A week passed and I lost interest in the guy I had been dating and decided to call it quits before we got to comfortable and I couldn't seem to get Chris' image out of my head. I wanted to see him and his band and I wanted to hangout with him. I regret not getting his number, and now sometimes while I am driving and I hear urlLink "Flagpole Sitta" by Harvey Danger , I wonder what could have been with me and Chris and where my life would be today if I just said something to him that night at the club. By the way, our paths never crossed again at that club, and I pretty sure in 3 years I haven't seen him just walking down the street.

Happiness: yours and mine Last night as I lay in bed trying to fall asleep and while watching the Gilmore Girls on LA's WB, a thought hit me, 'Is anyone really genuinely happy for themselves and or others?' . On television, on any show, when something good happens to someone, you can bet that their friends and family are genuinely happy for them. Whether they are sitting there by their side smiling or jumping up in the air for joy, they are really happy for them, but does this cross over into real life? Do people really feel happy when others get good news, when others win something? I see the hint of jealousy in everyone, even in myself at times when others get good news, we want that to be us. But there are times, I'd say 90% of the time that I am truly happy for other people. Just last week my girlfriend received a phone call from this guys he was really interested in, and it turns out he feels the same way. I was SOOOO excited for her that I literally jumped up and down when she was telling me, I thought to myself "Finally things are looking up for her!" Sometimes I think I am equally if not more happier about this than her. Then there is the eternal question of when will I be happy for myself. When will I jump up for joy for myself for once? When will I genuinely be happy for my own life and for my own good fortune? Sometimes I don't see and end in the near future, but most of the time I don't see an end at all. Which makes me wonder will we ever be truly happy?

"My God woman!" So this weekend I took pledge to start working out, starting today. What brought me to this decision you may be asking, well it's not the usual, "I need to drop a few pounds" , although that is a nice perk, but the real reason behind this hideous decision (and if you know me well then you know why this is a hideous decision), it's kinda embarrassing, but I guess I will share. The bottom line, I AM SO OUTTA SHAPE!!! The embarrassing part you are wondering, well I was at the movies Friday night watching Elf and as I made my way up back up to the top where I was sitting, I decided to skip a few steps and taking 2 or 3 at a time in order to make it to the top before the lights went off and the movie started. New Years Eve The year was 1997 and I was 19 years old. It was the second year that I was spending new years eve with friends and not my family. The year before we all were to young to get into a licensed club/bar so we opted to just hangout in a penthouse of a near by hotel. So this year was exciting, this year we would drink in the club, this year we would be dancing to music while we counted down, this year we were adults. Our plan was from the beginning to meet up at Andy's house and then take only 2 cars downtown to the hotel we were staying at, get ready, eat some dinner, and start drinking then so that not a lot of money needed to be spent in the club. At about 10:45pm and about 2 cases of beer later, we decided to leave the hotel and head over to the club which was about 7 blocks down the street. We started to walk in hopes that the 7 of us could hail ONE cab, on the busiest night of the year for cabs in one of the busiest cities. Needless to say no one would take the 7 of us and it was to risky to leave anyone behind to wait for the next cab, cause chances were that there wasn't going to be any other cabs. So we walked, 7 blocks, to the club, in the blistering cold that was about 25 degrees below zero with the wind chill. But we laughed, took it in stride and made the best of it. Once we got in the club, we all felt sober, I guess the cold does that to you, so after we checked our coats we made our way to the bar so that we could bring back that good feeling we had earlier in the hotel room. We drank and drank and finally we warmed up, and finally our wicked buzz had come back, now of course after downing another 3 or 4 drinks each, well you could imagine how drunk we were. So we danced and danced and drank all night long. The floor shock underneath our feet each time we jumped up and down, it felt as though we were going to fall through, but we didn't care. It was New Years Eve, in less than 20 minutes it was going to be 1998, "1998 can you believe?", we shouted at one another while we danced around to Prince's "Little Red Corvette". The countdown began and Lisa and Matt who were at the bar ran over to find us and we all shouted "9-8-7-6-5-4-3-2-1, HAPPY NEW YEAR!!!!" in unison like 5 year olds at a birthday party. We all hugged and kissed and laughed, drank champagne and danced till about 4 in the morning. Tired and staggering, we all walked back to the hotel, laughing at when Josh and I thought the floor was going to cave in, or when Lisa banged her head on the bathroom stale, when Dave kicked a cup that was lying outside of the club and then fell. When Matt locked himself in the bathroom and couldn't get out and Josh, Lisa, Eddie and I couldn't help him cause we were laughing to hard. When we finally made it back to our room, I believe about 45 minutes later because we all kept stopping to either laugh or throw up in a corner or a garbage bin, we were all so hungry, so we ordered a pizza and chicken wings (just in case Jessica Simpson is reading this and thinks I ate buffalo) and hungout lying in bed eating and watching cheesy music videos on MTV until we all slowly started falling asleep around 6am. The next morning I remember waking up at 8am to find Lisa awake and lying in bed next to me Josh and Eddie (we were only 19, no one worked full time so no one could afford more than one room so we had to sleep 4 to a bed, luckily we were all just friends), looking out the window at the snow blowing off the buildings next to us. We looked at each other and smiled, grabbed the phone and ordered room service for all of us. We checked out at about 11am, so we could all make it home in time for our Lunch/dinner with our families. On the drive home I remember all of us talking and sharing things that we did that some of us couldn't remember. We all shared our thoughts, as different as they all were, since we all had different views of the events that took place the night before, but one thing was the same no matter what, that was the best night we had ever had, even though it was all planned last minute and by that I mean the morning of December 31st. Six years later and I am still reminded of this one New Years Eve when everything was good and when we all made plans together. This year will be different, just like the past 4, that could never even come close to that night. Most of us won't be together, wait actually none of us will be together, and it's sad, and I want to go back and I know I can't. But me and Dave were just saying last night that we both would give anything to see him again fall from kicking a plastic glass on King Street at 4am.

Hello my name is Paris, and I need a reality check When I was younger, I used to think that you could do whatever you wanted no matter what, as long has you had enough courage and determination, your dreams would come true. These days I can't help but think that maybe we don't have all that control over our lives that I thought we had as a young girl. I am not trying to be negative, really I am not, but due to some circumstances over the last 10 years, I have come to realize that a lot of our live changes and choices all lie in the hands of fate, destiny and the man above. In certain instances I have seen something I had thoroughly planned out turn in the opposite direction only to have something fun turn into a disaster. I have planned on going certain places at certain times, only to end up in a different location, about 3 hours late. I have planned on enjoying a day at the beach, tanning my little butt off, and returning to the city just in time to watch the sunset over my house while I sat on the porch with friends drinking, but only to be home nearly after midnight due to an accident on the highway, my accident, where I totaled the car I planned on going cross country in the next summer. I had to get a new car, leaving me penniless and living paycheck to paycheck, leaving me no choice but to cancel the cross country trip and spend the summer working long hours on hot summer days. It was sometime that year that it finally hit me that I don't have control over anything and that everything is based on fate. This past weekend I saw an old friend of mine at a bar. I haven't seen her in over 4 years. I lost contact with her, well no, she actually lost contact with me. Either way, hadn't spoken to her or seen her or heard anything about her in awhile. Just last week while writing out my Christmas cards I came across her address in my address book and thought about sending her yet another card, just to let her know I was still thinking of her. And then it happen, I saw her. We both didn't recognize each other at first, but soon after we were talking like two best friends that didn't have 4 years of no contact between them. Later I wondered if this meant anything. If things do really happen for a reason, what was the reason for this? Why did I see her this weekend? Why did I decide to go out instead of staying home? What meaning did this have in the rest of my life? I don't know the answer and I don't even know if this had a particular meaning. All I know is that if I really do have no control and have no say in the way things are going to be, I really hope destiny guides me to have urlLink "Trouble" by Coldplay playing in the background when I go.

PMS maybe, but I highly doubt it! An open letter. To the Writers, Producers, Directors, Art Directors and Actors for the Hallmark commercials; Can you please stop making holiday commercials that make me weep for weeks at a time. Thank you, Paris

Don't you want somebody to love? Last week I was sitting at a bar and the bartender kept trying to hit on this girl who obviously didn't want to give him the time of day. He was pretty good looking, nice eyes, sweet personality, and thick chocolate brown hair. He was a looker alright, but still she just took her drink walked away and never came back to that side of the bar. He looked at me because he knew I was watching this, and he just smiled shrugged his shoulders and walked off. My heart kinda went out to him. I felt bad. As opposed to all the other bartenders in this world, he didn't seem like he was looking for a one night stand, he looked like he just wanted somebody to love and to love him back. Which brings me to Average Joe. I don't get that girl. So what they bring on 8 good looking men and all of a sudden you forget the bonds you made with the other "average" looking guys? The 8 "lookers" we will call them, were your typical jocks, looking for some ass and an easy fuck . And like a typical girl who chooses beauty before sweetness, she melted for all of them and fell into the trap and made the "average" (which weren't that average looking, they were cute in their own way) feel really bad about themselves, and for that she should be kicked off the "island". Why you may be wondering why this bothers me so much, well it cause I hate reality tv shows, and cause last nights episode made me cry a little.

Something borrowed, someone new Last night I posted before I headed out with some friends for drinks. I posted about time and about how everyone I knew on the web was 3 or more hours behind me. While I sat on the bar stool last night it occurred to me that here it was 11:45pm and somewhere on the west coast it was only 8:45pm, people were still getting ready to head out for the night while I was already 4 drinks into my night. Then it hit me, I am a lot more interested in the lives of people online then of the people sitting right in front of me. Are they just boring, or have I become one of the millions of people who find technology a better way to communicate? That being said I came home and surfed the net, downloaded some pictures and contemplated which photo printer I was going to buy in the coming weeks. I thought nothing of what had just happen at the bar, I just sat here wondering where everyone who's blogs I read were heading out for the night or where they were at that exact moment. Here it was 2:30am, but somewhere in LA and in Nevada, even Vancouver, BC it was only 11:30pm and people were either 30 minutes into the late show at the movies or standing in line at hot club on Sunset Blvd. For a minute I was envious, then I was actually curious. I had only seen pictures of the Los Angeles and I have only spent 4 days in Las Vegas, but part of me wished I was there living the lives of the people who post about them on their blogs. I wish I was on the West Coast. I know your thinking that if I was on the west coast, I would wonder what is going on on the east coast, but to be honest, I do wonder every now and then what the people in New York City are doing. What the temperature in South Carolina is and what the southerners are doing in Georgia. I am fascinated by other peoples lives, a voyeur if you will, who is looking for inspiration in her own life. Sad it may seem to some, but to me, I am just trying to make sense of it all, trying to put the pieces together. Really trying to decide what flight I will leave on in May.

Western Hemisphere I didn't realize that a lot of the pages I frequent on the net are always 3 hours behind me....I am on my way out now, it's 9:24pm here........heading out for drinks with some friends, if you can even call them that.......will take pictures, will report later...have fun...

Frustration It's snowing here again. It's been snowing on and off for the past 3 weeks. I am sick of snow. I am OCD (mild case of it anyway) and do you what it means to be OCD, have ADD and it's snowing? Well I will tell you. I compulsively feel the need to shovel the driveway all the time. Even if it is not that bad, even if there is just some random snow or slush anywhere near the driveway, I HAVE to get out of my car and shovel it before I go anywhere, even if it means that I will be late for work. As you can see I am still using this as my weblog, I haven't changed it and frankly I am giving in from frustration. I can't get it to work and I am just going to give in and quit! That's right folks I am a quitter! And I don't care. When is late, too late? How long do your 15 minutes have to be for them to make a good, E! True Hollywood Story about you? Can it even be 15 minutes, or do you have to have a semi-lifetime acting career, or a career in the spotlight, that long exceeds both those of The Rolling Stones and Audrey Hepburn? Do you need the “Triple Threat”, or can a mere stint somewhere in the newspapers get you one? These are the questions that have plagued me all day. In the mail today I received a card from my co-workers, well ex ones anyway. Inside were all their well wishes, how they will all miss my loud voice ringing in their ears as I walk in each morning and all the things I did just to make them laugh. It was like they all had a sample greeting emailed to them before the card was passed around, nonetheless it did the trick and I was glad to receive this on a day like today. But there were 2 that stuck out the most, both were from to ladies who knew me well and who knew how much I hated being there and how much I hated being attached to a phone and desk for 8 hours a day. At the end of their generic greeting each wrote this; And there they were the 9 words that have been said to me over and over for the past 10 days, here is your chance to do what you want . In the beginning these words were encouragement, these words the glimmer of hope I looked for every morning, these words were what made me realize that the company did me a favor by the restructuring. But now, today, as I sat there reading the card in front of my computer idling on the want ads online, I realized that I am confused. What was that thing I was able to do now, what was that thing that my company had given me the chance to do? I made a list the day this all happen, I made this list based on things I have always wanted to do, like acting, well being famous, writing, creating my own magazine, joining the cast on SNL, and being a photographer. To me at the time and for the past 20 years this list seemed realistic and I thought that if I really wanted to I could do all these things, but now they all seem like dreams that will never come true, dreams you have always known will never come true, even on that warm summer night in the park with a group of your friends all sitting around talking, where you declared that one day you would have accomplished one if not all of these things, you still kept that list close to you at all times as a reminder that money isn’t always everything and that happiness is. But today 10 days later I have no idea what I want to do or what that thing is, and all those good things that would make me happy, seem like something a 26 year old would have starting doing a long time ago, maybe sometime after high school. So now as I sit here typing this somewhat of a confession, I ask myself, how late is too late? Or better yet, how old, is too late?

Like seriously, come on now, does anyone need this in writing?

Seasons change, feelings no longer exist When I was a kid, every new season sparked some sort of joy in my life. Each first day of a new season I would jump out of bed, excitingly looking for snow, yellow grass covered with slush and sprinklers at high speed in both the back and front yards. Each season meant a new beginning a reason to start over fresh, a clean canvas if you will. With Winter came Christmas, Christmas holidays, Christmas gifts, hot chocolate snow days and snowmen, outdoor skating and my birthday in February which ultimately meant more gifts and chocolate frosted cake with candles and smarties smothering the cake. With each coming of Spring, my heart would race at the thought of jumping in puddles, raincoats, spring break somewhere warm with my family and later with friends and the Easter bunny who dropped off chocolate eggs at my bedroom door. Months later summer would roll in, which meant vacations by the lake, no more homework, no more getting out of bed before the 10 o'clock, TONS of swimming, playing hide-and-go-seek till midnight, short shorts, tanks tops, and the fact that you could wear your bathing suit as underwear on a daily basis and no one would say a thing, because back then they too were thinking in the back of their heads, "you never know when you might make a new friend with a pool", so you always had to be ready. Fall, regardless of the end of a summer romance and the starting of another dreaded school year, brought beautiful fall colours, trees losing their leaves, crisp morning air on the walk to school, Thanksgiving and the new fall prime time line up. And over the next few months winter would come and the cycle of ever changing seasons would begin once again. This joy, this excitement and this love for the new seasons would carry on with me through high school, where along with the gifts and the swimming and the vacations by the lake, came later curfews, hunky hot boys from out of town, the love for summer fashion and weekends up at a best friends chalet for skiing and snowboarding with yet again hot young boys from out of town. But as I get older and only 1 week into my 26th year I am realizing that things are changing, much like the seasons, the joy, the excitement, even the sadness that snow storms during Friday evening rush hour could only bring have slowly faded away. No longer do I long for the summer nights where I would drive around the city, windows down, music blaring whatever song was popular that week and the car filled with friends, the long drive up to my family's summer home on the beach for the weekend with friends, not even this season's fresh new looks for Spring and Summer. All these things no longer bring a smile to my face on a cold winter's day and they no longer spark a warm feeling throughout my body on snowy winter night, no longer do they hold a special place in my heart. For now as time has passed and people, like the season have changed, our close knit group that used to countdown the days till we could wear our flip flops again, has gone from 7 to 3 to 2 and I am afraid soon only to one. We have split up, they have moved on and are no longer in need of this friendship. Just like I am no longer in need of the changing of the seasons.

For a good time call 555-1255 Have you ever been in a room filled with both strangers and friends and feel like you are alone? That no one there notices you and that no one there even see's you or cares to acknowledge the fact that they stepped on your $190 shoes? I have been locked up in a room puking for 3 1/2 days. I know I could have used the word vomiting, but even with the word projectile in front of it it still wouldn't do any justice to the way I have been feeling these past 4 days. I have had the flu or better yet I have been feeling like I was about to die. Yes die. I know in the back of my head I was going to be fine once I had puked out a months worth of food, but in that time I swear I saw the light and it was a light vibrant green with a tinge of brown and orange. It was gross I will stop there. Needless to say that when I finally showered today after 4 days and put on a pair of jeans they didn't fit me all to well, it seems like I have lost a few pounds and it seems like I have lost a few friends. Why? I don't know but I tell you this, if this is what getting older means and if this is what it felt like for you when you were lonely in middle school, well then I feel for ya and it's too bad you had to go through this at such a young age. Cause now at 26, it hurts like hell, and I can't imagine what it felt like at 8.

....and Kat had pink hair She was walking around the office with another 5 or 6 women with pink hair as well. One of them was holding a sign that said "Vote Yes On Casual Fridays". They walked over to everyone's desk asking them to sign a petition and once you did they would give you pink hair dye to put in your hair so that when the bosses walked by they saw that you were for casual Fridays. When they came to my desk I signed with no hesitation at all. 80% was because I LOVE to wear jeans and 20% was because I got to dye my hair pink. 48 hours of Hell It's a time when you realize that god is made of porcelain. It is a time when the big shiny bowl is the only best friend you got. It's a time when the term "dry heaving" takes on a whole new meaning. And it is a time when you realize you could never be bulimic. Yes my friends I am talking about the flu. I barfed till there was nothing left to be barfed out. I was MIA for a while and no one knew what the hell happen to me. People just thought I stopped calling, when in fact it was just a little to hard to pick-up the phone or send you and email when your barfing in 15 minute intervals. And now that there is nothing left for me offer this porcelain god, I am left with body aches that could cripple any heavyweight and I have such bad shivers that I could star in one of those chocolate milk commercials where they emphasize that you SHAKE THE SHIT OUT of the bottle. Yes there was a time yesterday that I wished I was dead, and I realized that this was a fate worse then death. But then things got worse, I thought that there was nothing worse than barfing up yellow stomach/battery acid, but when you see a "For Sale" sign go up on your lawn, the lawn you spent many a years running in barefoot and carefree, well that is when your heart really starts to ache.

Nothing in Particular Now that I am home, I don't really have much to post about. I used to post about how much I hated my job and how I was hoping to find a new one as soon as possible. Now I just sit here, at my desk at home, and think of clever things to write about. I am not wearing anything green today because I don't look to hot in green. So I have opted for jeans and a grey NY t-shirt. See what I mean, nothing is going on.

August and Everything After It is hot, and it is sunny. The afternoon sun hits the front porch like a million candles burning in a rhythmic pattern, almost hypnotic. The air smells of humidity and the freeways are filled with motorists wishing they would have opted for the package that had A/C. The beaches are filled with people sun bathing and playing beach volleyball inches away from the ocean. I am here, it's 5 degrees outside and I can't wait any longer till this place warms up. When I was younger I used to wish that me and my family lived in a town that had one of the best beaches to vacation at during the summer break from school. A town where I could work on the board walk in some small wooden shack and sell French fries and homemade burgers with my best friend. We would meet almost everyone who walked the on the board walk that stretched out as far as the beach. At night we would go to the drive inn and watch bad summer horror flicks because my best friends twin brother would work there and he and his friends would let us hang out in the booths with them, watching the movies while we munched on free popcorn and water downed fountain pop. Our days off would be spent, lying lazily on the beach for hours, soaking up the sun and eating popsicles that we would get free from the younger boy who has had a crush on us since his first day on the job 4 years ago. The summer would have seemed endless, as the days would have lasted long past 9pm, and even after the sun had set, we would sit on the beach having bonfires and talking about what we would do come September when we would have to say goodbye to all the out of towners and start school again. Hearts would be broken and friendships would be lost, and the summer nights would slowly start to end earlier and the town would go back to being it's normal quiet self. Fall would come and life would go on, and we would take comfort knowing that soon it would be summer time again. I never got to spend a summer like that. I never got to do a lot of the things that I believe would have made me a different person and would have me in a different situation today. Sometimes I wake-up in the morning and wish I lived on my own, so I could lie in bed all day listening to the Counting Crows CD on repeat. "Round Here" is starting to have more meaning to me these days. A lot more then it did back in 1994 when I purchased it.

Forever pulling the strings of my heart My heart hurts and my stomach feels like a big empty hole whenever I think of urlLink this . I can't explain why, but it just does. I look at pictures and read stories about it and I find myself wishing I was there. It's like someone a long time ago sent me a postcard from Venice Beach that said "Wish you were here!", and I never forgot those words. But you see that never happen, no one ever sent me a post card from there. No one has ever brought me a key chain back from there either. I have never seen someone's vacation pictures from there, but still for nearly a decade now I have be fascinated with this place and I have no idea how or if I will ever get over this obsession. Some say if I visit I will get over it, and I think if I visit I might want to stay. Which wouldn't be a bad thing, just an expensive thing. Is it that wrong to want to go see a concert at the Hollywood Bowl? Is it that wrong to want to walk down Sunset Blvd.? Is it that wrong to want to run into a famous person buying coffee at a Starbucks?? Am I crazy to think that things would be better if I were there right now? Instead of being here in this cold city, with cold friends and nothing to do all day and night? I don't think so. And so what if I think that the grass is greener on the other side, most of you live there, so tell me is it any greener?

I need your help When I was younger I used to read a lot, so much that I was at the library about once every two weeks. I used to read books for young adults, books by R.L. Stine, about all those high school kids who went to parties where someone got murdered and the beach houses in the summer where their best friends brother's ghost now haunted the place. I used to love these books, I even sometime reread them. And then one day it stopped probably about the same time I realized that I was getting older and getting to old to read these books. So I stopped all together. Now these days with all this time on my hands and nothing challenging to do, I don't want to leave my brain not thinking and processing for too long. So I am asking for your help. I have no idea where to begin, so please leave me a comment about what books you think I should read, or better yet recommend I read. A lot of you who read this know the current state that I am in, I have reached a crossroad in my life with little direction, I want to move on to bigger and better things, but yet I lack motivation, even though Terrence stops by with his ever so greatly appreciated words of wisdom. So please help me, maybe some of you out there have read some good motivating books, please share. Oh and by the way, please no self help books, I live in a world where reality comes second to televisions fiction, so keep in mind that I want to see the underlining message for myself, I don't want it to be pointed out in bullet point form or by chapter name. Thanks a million in advance for your help. Paris

Day 15 - Ain't nothing working, ain't nothing right The title of this blog is becoming more and more a future endeavor as we speak. I have looked for work now for the last 15 days and there is nothing out there worth applying to. I am not even sure if I know what I am looking for exactly. I am at a crossroad, a fork in the road if you will, with what I am to do with my life. I have a crazy Aunt who is in here late 70's who resides in San Diego, who on a weekly basis calls here to try and convince me to go stay with her for a month. I know what your all thinking, this would be great my reason to come out to Cali, a reason to come stay there for longer than I can afford cause someone wants me to live with them for a month, but what you don't know is that when I say crazy Aunt, I mean crazy Aunt. Every other week on one of her weekly calls to convince me to come, she forgets which one I am. She thinks I am married some weeks and other weeks she still thinks I am 5. So basically what I am trying to say without being mean is that I would have to watch her 24/7, which would mean I would only get to see her condo for a month, and really how much fun could that be. So this is what I broke this down to; Life and God have a messed up sense of humor, here is the break down why: 1. I lose my job to restructuring 2. I have 4 weeks of severance pay. 3. I have nothing to do. 4. I have always wanted to go out to LA for longer than the 3 day trip I could afford. 5. I have an Aunt with an empty condo in San Diego. 6. My mom would pay for my flight. 7. Said Aunt in going crazy and she needs the constant care of a nurse. 8. I cannot go to LA to stay with her, even though I have nothing better to do. 9. I am stuck here for the rest of my life. You see how things never work out for me. Now you have had a glimpse into my almost-always-these-days-pessimistic-life. And according to this spell checker I can't even spell. God help me.

Lonely Place It's gloomy here today. It has been gloomy here for a few days now. This weather really gets to me and I have no way of controlling that. When it is sunny, I feel as though I can do anything or be anything I want. But on days like today, it's hard not to feel like a failure.

Holiday, celebrate..... My weekend here was a long one, yesterday was a holiday, Victoria Day, I do believe we were celebrating Queen Victoria's birthday, but don't quote me on that because I never paid attention during history in school and sometimes I really regret it, oh well I digress. So my weekend really wasn't too action packed, it rained pretty much all 3 days and at times we had tornado watches, yup tornado watches, at one point this weekend we could have been saying "were not in Kansas anymore". So anyway, I really didn't do much, I watched movies, "Texas Chainsaw Massacre", which made me no longer long for a road trip across the US, seeing as there are some really weird folk that live in your back woods. I also lounged around the house, visited friends and slept in, which I haven't done in a very long time ever since I started school, which by the way is going very well. I don't want to toot my own horn, but in my first class my final grade was a 98%. Toot, toot!! Other than that my weekend was ok, nothing to exciting, but still nice.

Hot time, summer in the city....... Wow it is hot here today! I mean I am on FIRE!!! It was 29 degrees here and with the humidity, it was 33. I love it, I really do. It hasn't been this hot since last August and oh how I have missed this weather so much. It's even nicer now that I am at home and I can enjoy it sitting in my backyard, that's right, backyard. Other than that I sit in my room doing school work or drive around with the windows down and let the air blow through my hair! But other than that not much is happening. I'm not complaining though, I love the way my life is right now, and I think once I am done school and working in a job I love it will be just as great. I am really trying to enjoy this warm weather cause I have a feeling it won't be this warm in the next couple of weeks. That's it for now. Come back soon. I have a feeling my stories will only get funnier.

Welcome Back I am back, from what was a well deserved break. After I got laid off from work, I went into bitter spiral of negative thoughts. I wasn't myself and decided that there was no need for the temporary me to be on the internet. So I sat back, waited out this bumpy ride and now I am back, better than ever. In the past month and a half a lot has happen. I won't fill you in on all the boring details, but I will tell you that I am still not working, by choice, but I am actually going back to school to get a degree and finally do something with my life that I want to do. That was the key element missing all these years, I wasn't doing something I wanted to do, I was doing something I had to do. But now I am back. It's really warming up here and I can't wait until it is officially summer. I plan on sitting in the backyard all summer and getting a nice tan. Other than that I plan on going swimming, drinking and enjoying my freedom from a 9 to 5 job. So that is where I have been, maybe some of you have missed me, maybe some of you never noticed, but I am back.

July 1st It's a long weekend this weekend and for once it will actually feel like the weekend to me, why? You ask, well that is because I will not be here from Thursday morning till Sunday night. We are going away for the weekend, a much needed and anticipated break from the city. I will pack my bags, turn off my computer and cell phone and spend some relaxing, quality time on the beach with a magazine and a good book and some good friends. I am really excited, I haven't done this since I was 21, wow a whole 5 years.

Here there and everywhere I haven't blogged in a while, I think about a week, which is a lot considering I used to blog every weekday and sometimes on the weekend. I mean I can't post everyday about tanning, or reading magazines or watching TV, I will add however that soap operas are really tacky. My days have been spent lounging outside, going for lunch, taking tests, completing assignments and enjoying the summer off. Other than that nothing is new. So for now I leave you with this and I hope something exciting happens this weekend and I can post all about it!

Summer Rules For the past, oh I'd say 10 years, I have been following the same rules each summer, and they are fun ones to live buy, so I thought I would share some with you. 1 . Always wear your swim suit under your clothes because you never know when you will encounter someone with a pool. (this includes casual Fridays at work) 2. Once you stop wearing closed shoes with socks, you are to never put on a pair of socks again until the temperature goes below 10 degrees. 3. You can never be too tanned. Once you get some colour, get more and more and more. 4. Never use anything higher than Tropicana Dark Tanning Oil SPF 4 on your legs. They take forever to get dark. Always use SPF 15 or higher everywhere else until you no longer burn. 5. Always have your toes nicely polished. I don't me get weekly $25- $30 pedicures, do it yourself at home. 6. Hit the beach whenever you can. Here in Canada we have 9 months of winter and 3 months of summer. HIT. THE. BEACH. A LOT. 7. Flip flops and tank tops are a must. Enough said. 8. Bikinis are always fun when you have a funky print on them. 9. Always dress like a surfer chick. You never know who is watching. 10. Always keep a towel and boardshorts in your trunk. See Rule #1. So those are my rules, do you have any?

Let me clear my throat There has been a lot of confusion on this website today, so I will straighten things out. I am not engaged, nor will I be anytime soon. That would just freak the shit out of me and I would lock myself in my room for days in hopes that it would all just go away. Yes I am a little weird when it comes to my own engagement, and I am not your typical girl just looking to get married. Not that anything is wrong with those types of girls, it's just not who I am.

Me settle down? Never For years there has been this type of woman, the "single sister" as I would like to call her, that has been portrayed in the movies as the independent, carefree, always on the go, type that you could call on for anything and they would be there in a minute. Always showed as the one who would walk into your home, open your fridge and help themselves to whatever they wanted. They loved your children and your children usually called them their favorite Aunt. They helped you set up birthday parties hours before it even began because they had no children or "family" of their own to hold them back. They were the "fun" sister and all of your friends who only had brothers, wished they had one for themselves. For years I have been this sister. Actually for 9 1/2 years, 2 nephews and 1 niece I have been this sister. The one you could call on for anything, at anytime any place, I would be there at the drop of a hat. In my family I am know as the cool aunt who when you turn 18 will take you to get your first tattoo and keep it a secret from your mom. I am the cool aunt who will jump into a pool fully clothed to splash as much water in your face. I am the cool aunt who will take you to McDonald's and let you get the happy meal only for the toy. I am the cool aunt who will show up at your house with ice cream on a really hot day. I am the cool aunt who will buy you all those silly toys you put on your wishlist at Christmas time. But all in all I have been the aunt who will always be single, carefree and independent, and who will one day when your old enough to understand, teach you how to be this way. But now, 26 1/2 years later, I am the aunt with a brand new joint account who is planning on a long term commitment that is freaking the shit out of her.

I remember posting about it and I also remember a few people out there who gave me some great words of advice. So now I would like to take the time to thank them. Jenny, for telling me that I could do and be whatever I wanted, as long as I tried. Kat who said that having education was always a good thing. Terrence who told me that it was never to late to go to school, actually he told me a story about a friend of his who was thinking of going to med school and wasn't sure because he when he was done in 4 years he was going to be a 32 year old doctor, and then someone told him that regardless of whether or not he went to school in 4 years he was going to be 32 years old. Anyway point being, if it wasn't for those 3 people and a few others here on this end, I would never have given going back to school a second thought. So THANKS! a million, I really appreciate it.

Heroes, Songs, Engines and Grasshoppers This past weekend is a bit of a blur, and as much as I would like to tell you that it was from a lot of heavy drinking, it's not, it's actually from doing too much in such a little amount of time. I saw Spider-man 2 this past weekend, and I have to admit it almost had me in tears, and I say almost because I forced myself to hold the tears back. I love the whole idea of superheros and I really wished that they existed in real life. Like tell me you wouldn't think it was cool if there was a bank robbery in progress right in the middle of you signing your mortgage papers and then bang, all of a sudden out of now where come this man in a blue and red, or any two colors for that matter, to save the day. I would love it! And I think I would be in love with said superhero and I think it should really be urlLink Tobey Maguire . Then last night we decided to head into the city after a long day of cleaning, shopping and cooking, to see what kind of "crazies" were out. And let me tell you that there was a ton! of crazies out last night. But we had a good time anyway, walking the crowded streets, talking with random "non-crazies", and dancing on the corner of Peter and Richmond. It was great! Until the drive home when my friends car was having engine trouble, which left us stranded on Bloor till 4am when the god damn thing started up again. The rest of the way home we just rubbed the dashboard while praying and saying good things about that piece of shit car. This morning we all headed out for breakfast and down to walk along the waterfront and throw rocks in dirty Lake Ontario. Then I came home, went online and realized that I hadn't blogged in a while and that I have a bad habit of doing that. So I decided that when I have nothing to blog about, I am going to post the lyrics that the song I currently have on repeat in my cd player and car. And that folks sums up my weekend and pretty much explains the title of this post, well all of it except that grasshopper, which flew into my friends ear today while walking along the waterfront. I was frickin' hilarious, until one threatened to jump into my ear.

An end to a somewhat era Since September 4th, 1984, we have owned a summer house near the lake, and ever since that day we have been spent many weekends and weekdays up there on the beach, sun tanning, swimming, relaxing and creating great memories. The till-this-day never paved road consisted of other summer homes occupied by cousins and now close friends of the family. Until I was about 14 years old, me and my family and all of our neighbor's up there would spend the last week of July and the first week of August up there all together. In the morning all the kids, about 15, ages ranging from 10-24, would head out for a walk after breakfast, then go down to the beach from 10am till noon, head back to the house, have lunch, and then head back to the beach from 2pm till 4pm. We would have swimming competitions, diving competitions, beach volleyball games, and sometimes sun tanning competitions. At night, once we were all showered and clean, all of us would head to my backyard and have BBQ together. The kids at one picnic table and the adults at another. We would laugh about what happened earlier at the beach, or cheer about how the girls bet the boys in the beach volleyball competition. We would help clean up the dishes and then all 15 of us would head to a nearby arcade. Some nights we would have a bonfire at one of our houses and talk about our lives back in the city, about what subjects we decided to take next year in high school or what major we decided on in college, and who we were dating back home. Other nights we would play hide-and-go-seek till midnight, or take long walks to nearby neighborhoods at 11 o'clock at night. This continued for many years, until of course we all got older, got full-time jobs and decided to get married and have children. And till this day when we are all up there we talk about those summer nights spent together running away from raccoons, or hiding our hair from low flying bats and thinking that things were never going to change and that no matter what we could always count on seeing each other up there. Yesterday my sister went up there with her family and called to tell us that just yesterday a for sale sign went up on one of the cottages that belonged to close family friends. My mom looked up and said "The first of many." I got up from the dinner table, walked into the bathroom and cried for 25 minutes.

Summer lovin' had me a blast.... Well I am back, it is 10:50pm and I just walked into the house about an hour ago. My weekend was really fun and relaxing. My days as I mentioned before were spent lounging on the beach getting a tan, swimming and playing beach volleyball. The evenings were spent making BBQ, sitting under the stars around a bonfire and sharing stories from when we were 19 years old. It was a blast and it was a great getaway that I think we will be doing at the end of the month again. I really needed this time away from the city and the hectic life that is Toronto living and to do some thinking about the next few steps I need to take to make this future of mine a little bit better and a lot more interesting. I also realize that today is 4th of July so a Happy Independence Day to all my American friends!!!!!!!!
